entry.title: General self-similarity: an overview
entry.summary: Informal seminar notes explaining the ideas in math.DS/0411344 and math.DS/0411345.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In Real and Complex Singularities (Proceedings of the Australian-Japanese Workshop, Sydney, 2005), World Scientific, 2007

entry.title: Positive topological entropy implies chaos DC2
entry.summary: Using methods of ergodic theory we prove as in the title.

entry.title: Diffeomorphisms with an anomalous growth of the differential
entry.summary: The paper is withdrawn.

entry.title: Rational Misiurewicz maps are rare II
entry.summary: We show that the set of Misiurewicz maps has Lebesgue measure zero in the space of rational functions for any fixed degree greater than or equal to 2 (generalising the earlier version math.DS/0701382).
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Communications of Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Dimension of the moduli space of a curve in the complex plane
entry.summary: We give a formula to compute the dimension of the generic component of the moduli space of an irreducible germ of curve in the complex plane.

entry.title: Schlesinger foliation for deformations of foliations
entry.summary: In this article, we show that for any deformation of analytic foliations, there exists a maximal analytic singular foliation on the space of parameters along the leaves of which the deformation is integrable.

entry.title: A quantitative Mean Ergodic Theorem for uniformly convex Banach spaces
entry.summary: We provide an explicit uniform bound on the local stability of ergodic averages in uniformly convex Banach spaces. Our result can also be viewed as a finitary version in the sense of T. Tao of the Mean Ergodic Theorem for such spaces and so generalizes similar results obtained for Hilbert spaces by Avigad, Gerhardy and Towsner (arXiv:0706.1512v2 [math.DS]) and T. Tao (arXiv:0707.1117v1 [math.DS]).

entry.title: Quasisymmetric conjugacies between unimodal maps
entry.summary: It is shown that some topological equivalency classes of S-unimodal maps are equal to quasisymmetric conjugacy classes. This includes some infinitely renormalizable polynomials of unbounded type.

entry.title: On the realization of fixed point portraits (an addendum to Goldberg, Milnor: Fixed point portraits)
entry.summary: We establish that every formal critical portrait (as defined by Goldberg and Milnor), can be realized by a postcritically finite polynomial.

entry.title: Ergodicity in Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We discuss the Sinai method of proving ergodicity of a discontinuous Hamiltonian system with (non-uniform) hyperbolic behavior.

entry.title: A toral diffeomorphism with a non-polygonal rotation set
entry.summary: We construct a diffeomorphism of the two-dimensional torus which is isotopic to the identity and whose rotation set is not a polygon.

entry.title: Ergodicity of conformal measures for unimodal polynomials
entry.summary: We show that for any unimodal polynomial $f$ with real coefficients, all conformal measures for $f$ are ergodic.

entry.title: A new advance in the Bernstein problem in mathematical genetics
entry.summary: A S. N. Bernstein problem is solved under a natural irreducibility condition. Earlier this result was obtained only in some special case.

entry.title: The Classification of Three-Dimensional Gradient Like Morse-Smale Dynamic Systems
entry.summary: The topological classification of gradient like Morse-Smale vector fields and diffeomorphisms on 3-manifolds was obtained.

entry.title: Homeomorphic restrictions of unimodal maps
entry.summary: Examples are given of tent maps $T$ for which there exist non-trivial sets $B \subset [0,1]$ such that $T:B \to B$ is a homeomorphism.

entry.title: On invariant measure structure of ergodic discrete dynamical systems
entry.summary: There is studied an invariant measure structure of a class of ergodicl discrete dynamical systems by means of the measure generating function method

entry.title: Canonical symbolic dynamics for one-dimensional generalized solenoids
entry.summary: We define canonical subshift of finite type cover for Williams' 1-dimensional generalized solenoids, and use resulting invariants to distinguish some closely related solenoids.

entry.title: Amenable groups, topological entropy and Betti numbers
entry.summary: We investigate an analogue of the L^2-Betti numbers for amenable linear subshifts. The role of the von Neumann dimension shall be played by the topological entropy.

entry.title: Easy and nearly simultaneous proofs of the Ergodic Theorem and Maximal Ergodic Theorem
entry.summary: A very short and direct proof along the lines of the Kamae-Katznelson-Weiss approach.

entry.title: A note on holomorphic extensions
entry.summary: We give a criterium of holomorphy for some type formal power series. This gives a stronger form of a Rothstein's type extension theorem for a particular ring of holomorphic functions.

entry.title: On Conley's Fundamental Theorem of Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we generalize Conley's fundamental theorem of dynamical systems in Conley index theory. We also conclude the existence of regular index filtration for every Morse decomposition.

entry.title: Real Polynomial Diffeomorphisms with Maximal Entropy: Tangencies
entry.summary: In this paper we use complex techniques to study the structure of real Henon diffeomorphisms of maximal topological entropy.

entry.title: Global bifurcation of homoclinic solutions of hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We provide global bifurcation results for a class of nonlinear hamiltonian systems

entry.title: On Contact Anosov Flows
entry.summary: Exponential decay of correlations for $\Co^{(4)}$ Contact Anosov flows is established. This implies, in particular, exponential decay of correlations for all smooth geodesic flows in strictly negative curvature.

entry.title: Slow area-preserving diffeomorphisms of the torus
entry.summary: We construct area-preserving real analytic diffeomorphisms of the torus with unbounded growth sequences of arbitrarily slow growth.

entry.title: $C^1$-generic dynamics: tame and wild behaviour
entry.summary: This paper gives a survey of recent results on the maximal transitive sets of $C^1$-generic diffeomorphisms.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 279--294

entry.title: Weyl manifolds and Gaussian thermostats
entry.summary: A relation between Weyl connections and Gaussian thermostats is exposed and exploited.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 511--526

entry.title: Uniform asymptotic bound on the number of zeros of Abelian integrals
entry.summary: We give a uniform asymptotic bound for the number of zeros of complete Abelian integrals in domains bounded away from infinity and the singularities.

entry.title: Dense set of large periodic points
entry.summary: It is shown that Devaney Chaotic systems have plenty of large periodic points.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 page no figures. submitted to Applied Mathematics Letters

entry.title: Positively expansive homeomorphisms of compact spaces
entry.summary: We give a new and elementary proof showing that a homeomorphism of a compact metric space is positively expansive if and only if the space is finite.

entry.title: Exponential decay of correlations for surface semi-flows without finite Markov partitions
entry.summary: We extend Dolgopyat's bounds on iterated transfer operators to suspensions of interval maps with infinitely many intervals of monotonicity.

entry.title: A Bilateral version of Shannon-Breiman-McMillan Theorem
entry.summary: We give a new version of the Shannon-McMillan-Breiman theorem in the case of a bijective action. We illustrate this new result with an example

entry.title: Rigidity of multiparameter actions
entry.summary: We survey some recent developments and applications of the study of the rigidity properties of natural algebraic actions of multidimensional abelian groups.

entry.title: Non uniform hyperbolicity and elliptic dynamics
entry.summary: We present some constructions that are merely the fruit of combining recent results from two areas of smooth dynamics: nonuniformly hyperbolic systems and elliptic constructions.

entry.title: Un theoreme de la limite locale pour des algorithmes Euclidiens
entry.summary: We prove a local limit theorem for the Euclidian algorithms ; standard, centred and odd, with any cost function of moderate growth.

entry.title: Topological classification of Morse-Smale flows on 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We construct a topological invariant for a Morse-Smale flow on a 3-manifold and prove that the flows are topologically equivalent iff their invariants are same.

entry.title: Decay of correlations for Henon maps
entry.summary: We show, for a class of automorphisms of C^k, that their equilibrium measures are exponentially mixing. In particular, this holds for (generalized) Henon maps.

entry.title: The measure of quadratic Julia-Lavaurs sets with a bounded type virtual Siegel disk is zero
entry.summary: We prove here one of the claims of the author's thesis.

entry.title: A Note On Application Of Singular Rescaling
entry.summary: Using Singular Rescaling We Prove Some Bifurcation Results. This note Presents short proofs for some Bifurcation results which had been appeared with other Authors

entry.title: Density of Orbits in Complex Dynamics
entry.summary: The authors discuss a question by Cerveau concerning density of orbits in complex dynamics

entry.title: Partial Hyperbolicity for Symplectic Diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: We prove that every robustly transitive and every stably ergodic symplectic diffeomorphism on a compact manifold admits a dominated splitting. In fact, these diffeomorphisms are partially hyperbolic.

entry.title: Rank one and mixing differentiable flows
entry.summary: We construct, over some minimal translations of the two torus, special flows under a differentiable ceiling function that combine the properties of mixing and rank one.

entry.title: The dynamic system of the traffic assignment problem: Part II. Computation
entry.summary: The paper has been merged into math/0503283
entry.arxiv:comment: The paper has been merged into math/0503283

entry.title: The dynamic system of the traffic assignment problem: Part III. Incorporating traffic dynamics
entry.summary: The paper has been merged into math/0503283
entry.arxiv:comment: The paper has been merged into math/0503283

entry.title: Feuilletages singuliers de codimension un, Groupoïde de Galois et intégrales premières
entry.summary: We study the Galois groupoid of a holomorphic singular codimension one foliation. Geometric and algebraic caracterisations using Godbillon-Vey sequences and classical first integral are given.

entry.title: A piece-wise affine contracting map with positive entropy
entry.summary: We construct the simplest chaotic system with a two-point attractor.

entry.title: Parabolic Julia Sets are Polynomial Time Computable
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that parabolic Julia sets of rational functions are locally computable in polynomial time.

entry.title: Feuilletages en droites, équations des eikonales et aures équations différentielles
entry.summary: We study complex vector fields with straight lines trajectories. Some applications to rational solutions of ikonals equations are given

entry.title: Periodic billiard orbits in right triangles II
entry.summary: Periodic billiard orbits are dense in the phase space of an irrational right triangle. A stronger pointwise density result is also proven.

entry.title: A short proof of affability for certain Cantor minimal $\Z^2$-systems
entry.summary: We will show that any extension of a product of two Cantor minimal $\Z$-systems is affable in the sense of Giordano, Putnam and Skau.

entry.title: Some Questions around The Hilbert 16th Problem
entry.summary: We present some questions and suggestion on the second part of the Hilbert 16th problem

entry.title: About analytic non integrability
entry.summary: We prove several general results on non existence of analytic first integrals for analytic diffeomorphisms possessing a hyperbolic fixed point.

entry.title: The Cost of Two-dimensional Rearrangement
entry.summary: In this paper, we give an estimate for the energy of a highly mixed diffeomorphism on a two-dimensional torus.

entry.title: Growth sequences for circle diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: We obtain results on the growth sequences of the differential for iterations of circle diffeomorphisms without periodic points.

entry.title: Siegel disks and renormalization fixed points
entry.summary: In this note we construct hyperbolic fixed points for cylinder renormalization of maps with Siegel disks.

entry.title: Ratner's theorem on SL(2,R)-invariant measures
entry.summary: We give a relatively short and self contained proof of Ratner's theorem in the special case of SL(2,R)-invariant measures.

entry.title: Construction of measures with dilation
entry.summary: We give a construction of measures with partial sum of Lyapunov exponents bounded by below.

entry.title: Smooth linearization of commuting circle diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: We show that a finite number of commuting diffeomorphisms with simultaneously Diophantine rotation numbers are smoothly conjugated to roations.

entry.title: A Simple Proof of Sharkovsky's Theorem Revisited
entry.summary: In this note, we present a simple non-directed graph proof of Sharkovsky's theorem which is different from the one given in [2].

entry.title: A Simple Proof of Sharkovsky's Theorem
entry.summary: In this note, we present a simple directed graph proof of Sharkovsky's theorem.

entry.title: Generic expanding maps without absolutely continuous invariant $σ$-finite measure
entry.summary: We show that a $C^1$-generic expanding map of the circle has no absolutely continuous invariant $\sigma$-finite measure.

entry.title: Exponential decay of correlations for the Rauzy-Veech-Zorich induction map
entry.summary: We prove exponential mixing for the Rauzy-Veech-Zorich induction map on the space of interval exchange transformations (Theorem 3)

entry.title: The size of the Julia set of meromorphic functions
entry.summary: We give a lower bound of the hyperbolic and the Hausdorff dimension of the Julia set of meromorphic functions of finite order under very general conditions.

entry.title: A note about rational representations of differential Galois groups
entry.summary: We give a description of the rational representations of the differential Galois group of a Picard-Vessiot extension.

entry.title: Endomorphisms of the plane preserving a pencil of curves
entry.summary: We classify endomorphisms of the plane that preserve a pencil of curves.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages. To appear in Internat. J. Math

entry.title: Laminated Currents
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the equivalence of two definitions of laminated currents.

entry.title: A proof of Culter's theorem on the existence of periodic orbits in polygonal outer billiards
entry.summary: We discuss a recent result by C. Culter: every polygonal outer billiard has a periodic trajectory.

entry.title: Ergodic theory of amenable semigroup actions
entry.summary: In this paper, among other things, we state and prove the mean ergodic theorem for amenable semigroup algebras.

entry.title: On algebraically integrable outer billiards
entry.summary: We prove that if the outer billiard map around a plane oval is algebraically integrable in a certain non-degenerate sense then the oval is an ellipse.

entry.title: Ergodic Theory: Nonsingular Transformations
entry.summary: This is a survey of nonsingular ergodic theory.

entry.title: Smooth ergodic theory
entry.summary: This is an expository article/encyclopedia entry explaining the history, techniques, and central results in the field of smooth ergodic theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: to appear, Encyclopedia of Complexity and System Science (Springer)

entry.title: On an identity of Ky Fan
entry.summary: We give several applications of an identity for sums of weakly stationary sequences due to Ky Fan.

entry.title: Time-preserving structural stability of hyperbolic differential dynamics with noncompact phase spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the structural stability of hyperbolic differential systems on Euclidean spaces using Liao theory.

entry.title: A positive solution to a conjecture of A. Katok for diffeomorphism case
entry.summary: In this paper, using Pesin theory and Liao theory, we give a positive solution to a conjecture of A. Katok.

entry.title: Hamiltonian Systems: Stability and Instability Theory
entry.summary: This is a short survey on Nekhoroshev theory, KAM theory, and Arnold's diffusion.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, J.-P. Francoise, G.L. Naber and Tsou S.T. (Ed.) (2006) 261

entry.title: A generic property of families of Lagrangian systems
entry.summary: We prove that a generic lagrangian has finitely many minimizing measures for every cohomology class.

entry.title: Markov Stochastic Operators of Heredity
entry.summary: Applying non-ergodic quadratic stochastic operator the continual family of weak ergodic non-homogeneous Markov chains is constructed.

entry.title: Expansive homoclinic classes
entry.summary: We prove that for $C^1$ generic diffeomorphisms, every expansive homoclinic class is hyperbolic.

entry.title: On the regularization of conservative maps
entry.summary: We show that smooth maps are $C^1$-dense among $C^1$ volume preserving maps.

entry.title: Simultaneous Binary Collisions for Collinear Four-Body Problem
entry.summary: SBC is not done
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors. no comments

entry.title: Weak isomorphisms between Bernoulli shifts
entry.summary: In this note, we prove that if G is a countable group that contains a nonabelian free subgroup then every pair of nontrivial Bernoulli shifts over G are weakly isomorphic.

entry.title: Sur les automorphismes reguliers de C^k
entry.summary: We show the uniqueness for the measure of maximal entropy for regular automorphisms of C^k.

entry.title: There are no C^1-stable intersections of regular Cantor sets
entry.summary: We show that there are no C^1-stable intersections of regular Cantor sets.

author.name: Carlos Gustavo Tamm de Araujo Moreira

entry.title: Ergodic Theorems for Homogeneous Dilations
entry.summary: Revision.

entry.title: Averages on annuli of Eulidean space
entry.summary: We study the range of validity of differentiation theorems and ergodic theorems for $\R^d$ actions, for averages on "thick spheres" of Euclidean space.

entry.title: Un theoreme de Kurosh pour les relations d'equivalence boreliennes
entry.summary: We prove a analog of Kurosh theorem for countable Borel equivalence relations giving the structure of sub-relations in free products.

entry.title: A Correspondence Principle for the Gowers Norms
entry.summary: We give a variation of the Furstenberg Correspondence which preserves the Gowers uniformity norms.
entry.arxiv:comment: Journal of Logic and Analysis, 4; February, 2012

entry.title: Global behaviour of a second order nonlinear difference equation
entry.summary: We describe the asymptotic behaviour and the stability properties of the solutions to a second order rational difference equation.

entry.title: The Ergodic Closing Lemma for Nonsingular Endomorphisms
entry.summary: We prove the ergodic Closing Lemma for Nonsingular Endomorphisms.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, typos corrected, and a reference added

entry.title: Expansive and fixed point free homeomorphisms of the plane
entry.summary: The aim of this work is to describe the set of fixed point free homeomorphisms of the plane under certain expansive conditions.

entry.title: Rational Misiurewicz maps for which the Julia set is not the whole sphere
entry.summary: We show that Misiurewicz maps for which the Julia set is not the whole sphere are Lebesgue density points of hyperbolic maps.

entry.title: A new definition of t-entropy for transfer operators
entry.summary: The article presents a new definition of t-entropy that makes it more explicit and simplifies the process of its calculation.

entry.title: Invariant measures involving local inverse iterates
entry.summary: We study some new invariant measures arising from local inverse iterates. Examples are also given.

entry.title: Preliminary results about a wide class of recursive nonlnear sequences
entry.summary: The paper investigates the properties of a nonlinear recursive sequence which includes several ones studied formerly in the literature.

entry.title: Bounded critical Fatou components are Jordan domains, for polynomials
entry.summary: We prove that, for polynomials, the boundary of any bounded Fatou component is a Jordan curve, except maybe for Siegel disks.

entry.title: Entropy for expansive algebraic actions of residually finite groups
entry.summary: We prove a formula for the sofic entropy of expansive principal algebraic actions of residually finite groups, extending recent work of Deninger and Schmidt.

entry.title: Espaces vectoriels échelonnés
entry.summary: The paper is concerned with group actions, in the context of analytic dynamical systems.

entry.title: There exists a topologically mixing IET
entry.summary: This paper uses a construction of M. Keane to show that there exists a topologically mixing interval exchange transformation.

entry.title: Naishul's Theorem for fibred holomorphic maps
entry.summary: We show that the fibred rotation number associated to an indifferent invariant curve for a fibred holomorphic map is a topological invariant.

entry.title: A type III_1 Bernoulli shift
entry.summary: We provide a construction of a product measure under which the shift on the two point product space is a type III_1 transformation.

entry.title: Classification des feuilletages moyennables par surfaces
entry.summary: We prove that the foliated Euler caracteristic classifies amenable measured foliations up to those defined by ergodic actions of the euclidian plane.

entry.title: Stably weakly shadowing transitive sets and dominated splittings
entry.summary: We prove that for any $C^1$-stably weakly shadowing transitive set $\Lambda$, either $\Lambda$ is a sink or a source, or $\Lambda$ admits a dominated splitting.

entry.title: Evolution equations for a cubic stochastic process
entry.summary: By analogue of [1,2] we define a cubic stochastic process and study evolution (dynamics) of a system $E$ which contains at least three elements.

entry.title: On some non-conformal fractals
entry.summary: This paper presents a simple method of calculating the Hausdorff dimension for a class of non-conformal fractals.

entry.title: Translation Surfaces With Finite Veech Groups
entry.summary: We prove that every finite subgroup of $GL_{2}(\mathbb{R})$ can be realized as the Veech group of some translation surface.

entry.title: Quantization of Lyapunov functions
entry.summary: We investigate discret conditions for stability and asymptotic stability by Lyapunov and the point of equilibrium of autonomous system of differential equations.

entry.title: Integrality and rigidity for postcritically finite polynomials
entry.summary: We give an arithmetic proof of rigidity for postcritically finite polynomials.

entry.title: Measures Invariant Under Horospherical Subgroups in Positive characteristic
entry.summary: We prove measure rigidity for the action of (maximal) horospherical subgroups on homogeneous spaces obtained by quotient by a uniform (nonuniform) arithmetic lattices over a field of positive characteristic.

entry.title: Unipotent Flows And Isotropic Quadratic Forms In Positive Characteristic
entry.summary: The analogous statement to Oppenheim conjecture over a local field of positive characteristic is proved. The dynamical argument is most involved in the case of characteristic 3.

entry.title: A special case of effective equidistribution with explicit constants
entry.summary: An effective equidistribution with explicit constants for the isometry group of rational forms with signature $(2,1)$ is proved. As an application we get an effective discreteness of Markov spectrum.

entry.title: A note on Diophantine-type fractals for α-Lüroth systems
entry.summary: The Hausdorff dimensions of certain sets of real numbers described in terms of the \alpha-L\"uroth expansion are given.

entry.title: Rationality of the zeta function for Ruelle-expanding maps
entry.summary: We will prove that the zeta function for Ruelle-expanding maps is rational.

entry.title: Entropy and Escape of Mass for Hilbert Modular Spaces
entry.summary: We study the relation between metric entropy and escape of mass for the Hilbert modular spaces with the action of a diagonal element.

entry.title: A note on the isomorphism of Cartesian products of ergodic flows
entry.summary: We show an isomorphism stability property for Cartesian products of either flows with joining primeness property or flows which are $\alpha$-weakly mixing.

entry.title: Periodic trajectories in the regular pentagon
entry.summary: We study periodic linear trajectories in the double pentagon and periodic billiard trajectories in the regular pentagon.

entry.title: Dynamics of non-metric manifolds
entry.summary: An attempt is made to extend some of the basic paradigms of dynamics, from the viewpoint of (continuous) flows, to non-metric manifolds.

entry.title: Partial Hyperbolicity and Homoclinic Tangencies
entry.summary: We show that any diffeomorphism of a compact manifold can be C1 approximated by diffeomorphisms exhibiting a homoclinic tangency or by diffeomorphisms having a partial hyperbolic structure.

entry.title: Entropy and Ergodic Measures for Toral Automorphisms
entry.summary: We show that for every linear toral automorphism, especially the non-hyperbolic ones, the entropies of ergodic measures form a dense set on the interval from zero to the topological entropy.

entry.title: Partial hyperbolicity on 3-dimensional nilmanifolds
entry.summary: Every partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism on a 3-dimensional nilmanifold is leaf conjugate to a nilmanifold automorphism.

entry.title: On triangular billiards
entry.summary: We prove a conjecture of Kenyon and Smillie concerning the nonexistence of acute rational-angled triangles with the lattice property.

entry.title: Thermodynamics for geodesic flows of rank 1 surfaces
entry.summary: We investigate the spectrum of Lyapunov exponents for the geodesic flow of a compact rank 1 surface.

entry.title: Puiseux series dynamics of Quadratic rational maps
entry.summary: We give a complete description for the dynamics of quadratic rational maps with coefficients in the completion of the field of formal Puiseux series.

entry.title: Dominated chain recurrent class with singularities
entry.summary: We prove that for generic three-dimensional vector fields, domination implies singular hyperbolicity.

entry.title: Stable Configurations of repelling points on compact hyperbolic Manifolds
entry.summary: It is shown that on compact hyperbolic manifolds, certain stable configurations of points which mutually repel along all interconnecting geodesics become equidistributed as the number of points increases

entry.title: Open problems in local discrete holomorphic dynamics
entry.summary: This paper contains a selection, dictated by personal taste and by no means complete, of open problems in local discrete holomorphic dynamics.

entry.title: Weak Closure Theorem for Double Staircase Actions
entry.summary: We introduce a double staircase construction $T$ and show that the weak closure of $\{T^n\}$ is $\{\int, 2^{-m}T^n+(1-2^{-m})\int \ : m\in\N,\ n\in \Z\}.$

entry.title: On Mixing of Staircase Transformations
entry.summary: We prove the mixing for all staircase transformations satisfied the conditions $r_j/h_j\to 0$ + $r_j\to\infty$.

entry.title: Volume entropy rigidity of non-positively curved symmetric spaces
entry.summary: We characterize symmetric spaces of non-positive curvature by the equality case of general inequalities between geometric quantities

entry.title: Homeomorphisms generated from overlapping affine iterated function systems
entry.summary: We develop the theory of fractal homeomorphisms generated from pairs of overlapping affine iterated function systems.

entry.title: Homogeneous approximation for flows on translation surfaces
entry.summary: We consider how quickly a typical point returns to neighborhoods of itself under the flow in a typical direction on a translation surface.

entry.title: Recurrence for stationary group actions
entry.summary: Using a structure theorem from [FG2010] we prove a version of multiple recurrence for sets of positive measure in a general stationary dynamical system.

entry.title: On Regularity, Transitivity, and Ergodic Principle for Quadratic Stochastic Volterra Operators
entry.summary: In this paper we showed an equivalence of notions of regularity, transitivity and Ergodic principle for quadratic stochastic Volterra operators acting on the finite dimensional simplex.

entry.title: Perturbations of flexible Lattès maps
entry.summary: We prove that any Latt\`es map can be approximated by strictly postcritically finite rational maps which are not Latt\`es maps.

entry.title: Captures, matings and regluings
entry.summary: In parameter slices of quadratic rational functions, we identify arcs represented by matings of quadratic polynomials. These arcs are on the boundaries of hyperbolic components.

entry.title: Lower bounds on directional complexity for irrational triangle billiards
entry.summary: We provide explicit lower estimates on the complexity growth in typical directions for a class of irrational triangle billiards

entry.title: Quantitative ergodic theorems for weakly integrable functions
entry.summary: Under suitable hypotheses we establish a quantitative pointwise ergodic theorem which applies to trimmed Birkhoff sums of weakly integrable functions.

entry.title: The variational principle of local pressure for actions of sofic group
entry.summary: This study establishes the variational principle for local pressure in the sofic context.

entry.title: Maximally transitive semigroups of $n\times n$ matrices
entry.summary: We prove that, in both real and complex cases, there exists a pair of matrices that generates a dense subsemigroup of the set of $n\times n$ matrices.

entry.title: Polynomial Global Product Structure
entry.summary: An Anosov diffeomorphism is topologically conjugate to an infranilmanifold automorphism if and only if it has polynomial Global Product Structure.

entry.title: Arithmetic of Unicritical Polynomial Maps
entry.summary: This note will study complex polynomial maps of degree $n\ge 2$ with only one critical point.

entry.title: On the Boundedness of Solutions of a Rational System with a Variable Coefficient
entry.summary: We establish the boundedness character of solutions of a system of rational difference equations with a variable coefficient

entry.title: C^r surface diffeomorphisms with no maximal entropy measure
entry.summary: For any $1\leq r<\infty$, we build on the disk and therefore on any manifold, a $C^r$-diffeomorphism with no measure of maximal entropy.

entry.title: Bifurcation currents in holomorphic families of rational maps
entry.summary: The aim of these lectures is the study of bifurcations within holomorphic families of polynomials or rational maps by mean of ergodic and pluripotential theoretic tools.

entry.title: Devaney's chaos revisited
entry.summary: In this note, we give several equivalent definitions of Devaney's chaos

entry.title: No entire function with real multipliers in class S
entry.summary: We prove that there is no entire transcendental function in class S with real multipliers of all repelling periodic orbits.

entry.title: Converse KAM theory revisited
entry.summary: For an integrable Hamiltonian with $d\ (d\geq 2)$ degrees of freedom, we show the conditions on perturbations, for which invariant tori can be destructed.

entry.title: Complexity growth of a typical triangular billiard is weakly exponential
entry.summary: We provide a weakly exponential complexity upper bound for typical triangular billiards
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 10 figures. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1202.1244

entry.title: Ergodicity and partial hyperbolicity on the 3-torus
entry.summary: If a non-ergodic, partially hyperbolic diffeomorphism on the 3-torus is homotopic to an Anosov diffeomorphism $A$, it is topologically conjugate to $A$.

entry.title: Invariant formulation of a variational problem
entry.summary: In this paper we present a Hamiltonian formulation of multisymplectic type of an invariant variational problem on smooth submanifold of dimension $p$ in a smooth manifold of dimension $n$ with $p<n$.

entry.title: Endomorphismes aleatoires dans les espaces projectifs II
entry.summary: We study random holomorphic endomorphisms of P^k(C). This article is the second part of arXiv:1205.1601

entry.title: $S$-adic conjecture and Bratteli diagrams
entry.summary: In this note we apply a substantial improvement of a result of S. Ferenczi on $S$-adic subshifts to give Bratteli-Vershik representations of these subshifts.

entry.title: Periodic Points on the 2-sphere
entry.summary: For a $C^{1}$ degree two latitude preserving endomorphism $f$ of the 2-sphere, we show that $f$ has $2^{n}$ periodic points.

entry.title: On almost streamline and invisible surfaces
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to errors and bad formalization.

entry.title: Three Brouwer fixed point theorems for homeomorphisms of the plane
entry.summary: We prove three theorems giving fixed points for orientation preserving homeomorphisms of the plane following forgotten results of Brouwer.

entry.title: Existence of a class of rotopulsators
entry.summary: We prove the existence of a class of rotopulsators for the n-body problem in spaces of constant curvature of dimension k>=2.

entry.title: Lipschitz inverse shadowing for nonsingular flows
entry.summary: We prove that Lipschitz inverse shadowing for nonsingular flows is equivalent to structural stability.

entry.title: Extremal trigonometric polynomials and the problem of optimal stabilization of chaos
entry.summary: The paper contains an example of harmonic analysis applications to the problem of chaos stabilization by the DFC methods

entry.title: On expanding foliations
entry.summary: Certain families of manifolds which support Anosov flows do not support expanding, quasi-isometric foliations.

entry.title: Pesin theory and equilibrium measures on the interval
entry.summary: We use Pesin theory to study possible equilibrium measures for piecewise monotone maps of the interval. The maps may have unbounded derivative.

entry.title: Closing geodesics in $C^1$ topology
entry.summary: Given a closed Riemannian manifold, we show how to close an orbit of the geodesic flow by a small perturbation of the metric in the $C^1$ topology.

entry.title: Measures maximizing topological pressure
entry.summary: We give a general method on the way of approximating equilibrium states for a dynamical system of a compact metric space.

entry.title: Small Generalized Breathers with Exponentially Small Tails for Klein-Gordon Equations
entry.summary: We consider a class of nonlinear Klein-Gordon equation $u_{tt}=u_{xx}-u+f(u)$ and show that generically there exist small breathers with exponentially small tails.

entry.title: Basic Topological Structure of Fast Basins
entry.summary: We define fractal continuations and the fast basin of the IFS and investigate which properties they inherit from the attractor. Some illustrated examples are provided.

entry.title: An abstract KAM theorem
entry.summary: The KAM iterative scheme turns out to be effective in many problems arising in perturbation theory. I propose an abstract version of the KAM theorem to gather these different results.

entry.title: On centralizers of interval diffeomorphisms in critical (intermediate) regularity
entry.summary: We extend to the critical (intermediate) regularity several results concerning rigidity for centralizers and group actions on the interval.

entry.title: Analytic uniquely ergodic volume preserving maps on odd spheres
entry.summary: We construct examples of volume-preserving uniquely ergodic (and hence minimal) real-analytic diffeomorphisms on odd-dimemsional spheres

entry.title: Cotlar's ergodic theorem along the prime numbers
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to prove Cotlar's ergodic theorem modeled on the set of primes.

entry.title: Un theoreme de semi-continuite pour l'entropie des applications meromorphes
entry.summary: We prove a theorem of uppersemicontinuity for the metric entropy of meromorphic maps.

entry.title: A (short) survey on Dominated Splitting
entry.summary: We present here the concept of Dominated Splitting and give an account of some important results on its dynamics.

entry.title: Julia Sets and wild Cantor sets
entry.summary: There exist uniformly quasiregular maps $f:\mathbb{R}^3 \to \mathbb{R}^3$ whose Julia sets are wild Cantor sets.

entry.title: Lyapunov functions via Whitney's size functions
entry.summary: In this paper we present a technique for constructing Lyapunov functions based on Whitney's size functions. Applications to asymptotically stable equilibrium points, isolated sets, expansive homeomorphisms and continuum-wise expansive homeomorphisms are given.

entry.title: Criterion for quasi-anosovian diffeomorphisms of closed manifolds
entry.summary: Quasi-Anosov diffeomorphism is a kind of important dynamical system due to R. Mane 1970s. In this paper, we present a criterion for such dynamics using ergodic theory.

entry.title: On the symmetries of a Rikitake type system
entry.summary: A symplectic realization and some symmetries of a Rikitake type system are presented.

entry.title: Stability of KAM tori for nonlinear Schrodinger equation
entry.summary: It is proved that the KAM tori (thus quasi-periodic solutions) are long time stable for nonlinear Schrodinger equation.

entry.title: Mixing Flows with Homogeneous Spectrum of Multiplicity Two
entry.summary: A mixing flow with homogeneous spectrum of multiplicity 2 is presented.

entry.title: Schroedinger's equation and "bike tracks" - a connection
entry.summary: This note demonstrates an equivalence between two classes of objects: the stationary Schroedinger equation on the one hand and the "bicycle tracks" on the other.

entry.title: Distributional chaos and factors
entry.summary: We show the existence of a dynamical system without any distributionally scrambled pair which is semiconjugated to a distributionally chaotic factor.

entry.title: Dipoles and Pixie dust
entry.summary: Every closed subset of the Riemann sphere can be approximated in the Hausdorff topology by the Julia set of a rational map.

entry.title: Invertible dynamics on blow-ups of P^k
entry.summary: We discuss automorphisms and pseudo-automorphisms on blowups of complex projective space with an eye to finding ones with interesting dynamical behavior.

entry.title: Some Aspects of Multifractal analysis
entry.summary: The aim of this survey is to present some aspects of multifractal analysis around the recently developed subject of multiple ergodic averages. Related topics include dimensions of measures, oriented walks, Riesz products etc.

entry.title: Optimal embedding of Meyer sets into model sets
entry.summary: We give a constructive proof that a repetitive Meyer multiple set of $\mathbb{R}^d$ admits a smallest model multiple set containing it colorwise.

entry.title: Kinematic expansive suspensions of irrational rotations on the circle
entry.summary: We shall show that the rotation of some irrational rotation number on the circle admits suspensions which are kinematic expansive.

entry.title: Horocycle flows without minimal sets
entry.summary: We show that the horocycle flows of open tight hyperbolic surfaces do not admit minimal sets.

entry.title: On bifurcations in degenerate resonance zones
entry.summary: For Hamitonian systems with 3/2 degrees of freedom close to nonlinear integrable and for symplectic maps of the cylinder, bifurcations in degenerate resonance zones are discussed.

entry.title: Normal bases of algebras with low growth
entry.summary: This paper investigates the normal bases of algebras with low growth.

entry.title: Rotation Numbers for $S^2$ diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: These largely expository notes describe the properties of the function ${\cal R}$ which assigns a number to a $4$-tuple of distinct fixed points of an orientation preserving homeomorphism or diffeomorphism of $S^2$.

entry.title: Dynamics of Polynomial Diffeomorphisms of $C^2$: Foliations and laminations
entry.summary: This essay summarizes the state of the art on some aspects of the dynamics of polynomial diffeomorphsms in complex dimension two, and it presents a number of open questions.

entry.title: A Proof of the Ergodic Theorem using Nonstandard Analysis
entry.summary: The following paper follows on from work by Kamae, and gives a rigorous proof of the Ergodic Theorem, using nonstandard analysis.

entry.title: Multiple Forced rotations for the N-pendulum Equation
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the planar forced N-pendulum equation. Multiple rotational solutions are obtained.

entry.title: Rotational solutions of prescribed period of Hamiltonian systems on $\R^{2n-k}\ts T^k$
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider Hamiltonian systems on $\R^{2n-k}\ts T^k$. Multiple rotational solutions are obtained.

entry.title: On the monodromy of almost toric fibrations on the complex projective plane
entry.summary: The monodromy of almost toric Lagrangian fibrations on the complex projective plane is described.

entry.title: The Scenery Flow for Self-Affine Measures
entry.summary: We describe the scaling scenery associated to Bernoulli measures supported on separated self-affine sets under the condition that certain projections of the measure are absolutely continuous.

entry.title: Théorie KAM
entry.summary: Lectures given on KAM theory at the University of Ouargla (Algeria). I present a functional analytic treatment of the subject which includes KAM theory into the general framework of deformations and singularity theory.

entry.title: Data Assimilation: A Mathematical Introduction
entry.summary: These notes provide a systematic mathematical treatment of the subject of data assimilation.

entry.title: Real analytic counterexample to the freeness conjecture
entry.summary: We provide a counterexample to P.~Olver's freeness conjecture for $C^\omega$ transformations.

entry.title: Anomalous cw-expansive surface homeomorphisms
entry.summary: We prove that the genus two surface admits a cw-expansive homeomorphism with a fixed point whose local stable set is not locally connected.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1409.3887

entry.title: On the fixed points set of differential systems reversibilities
entry.summary: We extend a result proved in \cite{Col} for mirror symmetries of planar systems to measure-preserving non-linear reversibilities of $n$-dimensional systems, dropping the analyticity and nondegeneracy conditions.

entry.title: Partial linearization for nonautonomous differential equations
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove the partial linearization for n-dimensional nonautonomous differential equations. The conditions are formulated in terms of the dichotomy spectrum.

entry.title: Thermodynamic formalism for some systems with countable Markov structures
entry.summary: We study ergodic properties of certain piecewise smooth two-dimensional systems by constructing countable Markov partitions. Using thermodynamic formalism we prove exponential decay of correleations.

entry.title: IPr* recurrence and nilsystems
entry.summary: We prove that nilsystems possess the IPr*-recurrence property and, moreover, are characterized by this property.

entry.title: On the Roots of Characteristic Equations of Delay Differential Systems
entry.summary: We prove that characteristic equations of certain types of delay differential systems, under some mild conditions on their coefficients, can possess infinitely many complex roots.

entry.title: Introduction to complex dynamics in one dimension
entry.summary: These are notes from elementary lectures given in the summer of 2013 at the YMSC center at Tsinghua University in Beijing.

entry.title: Symbolic Dynamics for Normally Hyperbolic Foliations
entry.summary: We introduce some tools of symbolic dynamics to study the hyperbolic directions of partially hyperbolic diffeomorphisms, emulating the well known methods available for uniformly hyperbolic systems.

entry.title: Random walk in a stratified medium
entry.summary: We study the recurrence properties of a random walk in a stratified medium.

entry.title: Dirac physical measures for generic diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: We prove that, for a $C^1$ generic diffeomorphism, the only Dirac physical measures with dense statistical basin are those supported on sinks.

entry.title: The Pitchfork Bifurcation
entry.summary: We give development of a new theory of the Pitchfork bifurcation, which removes the perspective of the third derivative and a requirement of symmetry.

entry.title: Cross-sections of multibrot sets
entry.summary: We identify the intersection of the multibrot set of $z^d+c$ with the rays ${\mathbb R}^+\omega$, where $\omega^{d-1}=\pm1$.

entry.title: Equivariant thinning over a free group
entry.summary: We construct entropy increasing monotone factors in the context of a Bernoulli shift over the free group of rank at least two.

entry.title: Mather measures for space-time periodical nonconvex hamiltonians
entry.summary: The main goal of this paper is to construct Mather measures for space-time periodical nonconvex Hamiltonians.

entry.title: On the Pollicott-Ruelle resonances
entry.summary: The purpose of this survey is to present the recent advances about the Pollicott-Ruelle resonances.

entry.title: Computational intractability of attractors in the real quadratic family
entry.summary: We show that there exist real quadratic maps of the interval whose attractors are computationally intractable. This is the first known class of such natural examples.

entry.title: Shrinking targets on Bedford-McMullen carpets
entry.summary: We describe the shrinking target set for the Bedford-McMullen carpets, with targets being either cylinders or geometric balls.

entry.title: Hausdorff--Lebesgue dimension of attractors
entry.summary: In the present paper the classical ideas of Hausdorff and Lebesgue are combined and the Hausdorff--Lebesgue measure is introduced. This makes it possible to obtain new results in chaotic dynamics.

entry.title: Periodic approximation of Oseledets subspaces for semi-invertible cocycles
entry.summary: We prove that, for semi-invertible linear cocycles, Oseledets subspaces associated to ergodic measures may be approximated by Oseledets subspaces associated to periodic points.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1511.08423

entry.title: Equivalent definitions of oscillating sequences of higher orders
entry.summary: In this note, we give several equivalent definitions of oscillating sequences of higher orders in terms of their disjointness from different dynamical systems on tori.

entry.title: Cyclic hyperbolic Veech groups in finite area
entry.summary: We prove that there are finite area flat surfaces whose Veech group is an infinite cyclic group consisting of hyperbolic elements

entry.title: Devaney chaos, Li-Yorke chaos, and multi-dimensional Li-Yorke chaos for topological dynamics
entry.summary: In this paper, we study various chaos of topological group or semigroup actions.

entry.title: Perturbation of periodic orbits of Rabinovich system
entry.summary: In this paper we stabilize asymptotically the periodic orbits of the Rabinovich system.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1506.02144 by other authors

entry.title: Robust tangencies of large codimension
entry.summary: We construct $C^2$-robust homoclinic and heterodimensional tangencies of large codimension inside transitive partially hyperbolic sets.
entry.arxiv:comment: This article is the first part of arXiv:1509.05325

entry.title: Dense semigroups of triangular matrices
entry.summary: Let $\mathbb{K}=\mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$, and $T_n(\mathbb{K})$ be the set of $n\times n$ lower triangular matrices with entries in $\mathbb{K}$. We show that $T_n(\mathbb{K})$ has dense subsemigroups that are generated by $n+1$ matrices.

entry.title: A relative, strictly ergodic, locally compact Cantor model theorem for infinite measure-preserving systems
entry.summary: We prove a model theorem for factor maps between ergodic, infinite measure-preserving systems.

entry.title: A class of Lorenz-type systems, their factorizations and extensions
entry.summary: It is well known that the Lorenz system has $Z_2$-symmetry. Using introducted in math.DS/0105147 topological covering-coloring a new representation for the Lorenz system is obtained. Deleting coloring leads to the factorized Lorenz system that is in a sense more fundamental than the original one. Finally, $Z_n$ extensions define a class of Lorenz-type systems. The approach admits a natural generalization for regular and chaotic systems with arbitrary symmetries.

entry.title: Pointwise convergence of averages along cubes II
entry.summary: Let $(X,\mathcal{B},\mu, T)$ be a measure preserving system. We prove the pointwise convergence of averages along cubes of $2^{k}-1$ bounded and measurable functions for all $k$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, latex, initially. Now it 10 pages long. It is modified accordingly to the changes made in the paper math.DS/0305388 which deals with the averages of three and seven functions and the weakly mixing case

entry.title: On a certain class of $g$-functions for subshifts
entry.summary: A property $(D)$ of subshifts was defined in: Wolfgang Krieger, On $g$-functions for subshifts, IMS Lecture Notes- Monograph Series, Vol. 48, Dynamics & Stochastics (2006) 306 - 316, arXiv:math.DS/0608259. With a view towards a theory of $g$-fnctions beyond the case of finte type subshifts partially defined continuous $g$-functions of property $(D)$ subshifts are studied.

entry.title: McCulloch-Pitts brains and pseudorandom functions
entry.summary: In a pioneering classic, Warren McCulloch and Walter Pitts proposed a model of the central nervous system. Motivated by EEG recordings of normal brain activity, Chv\'atal and Goldsmith asked whether or not these dynamical systems can be engineered to produce trajectories which are irregular, disorderly, apparently unpredictable. We show that they cannot build weak pseudorandom functions.

entry.title: A general theory of self-similarity I
entry.summary: Consider a self-similar space X. A typical situation is that X looks like several copies of itself glued to several copies of another space Y, and Y looks like several copies of itself glued to several copies of X, or the same kind of thing with more than two spaces. Thus, the self-similarity of X is described by a system of simultaneous equations. Here I formalize this idea and the notion of a `universal solution' of such a system. I determine exactly when a system has a universal solution and, when one does exist, construct it. A sequel (math.DS/0411345) contains further results and examples, and an introductory article (math.DS/0411343) gives an overview.

entry.title: Existence of attractors for three-dimensional flows
entry.summary: We prove the results in [1] using Theorem 1 of the recent paper [2] by Crovisier and Yang. References: [1] Arbieto, A., Rojas, C., Santiago, B., Existence of attractors, homoclinic tangencies and singular-hyperbolicity for flows, arXiv:1308.1734v1 [math.DS] 8 Aug 2013. [2] Crovisier, S., Yang, D., On the density of singular hyperbolic three-dimensional vector fields: a conjecture of Palis, arXiv:1404.5130v1 [math.DS] 21 Apr 2014.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages. arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1308.1734 by other authors

entry.title: New examples of manifolds with completely integrable geodesic flows
entry.summary: We construct Riemannian manifolds with completely integrable geodesic flows, in particular various nonhomogeneous examples. The methods employed are a modification of Thimm's method, Riemannian submersions and connected sums.

entry.title: Singular measures in circle dynamics
entry.summary: Critical circle homeomorphisms have an invariant measure totally singular with respect to the Lebesgue measure. We prove that singularities of the invariant measure are of Holder type. The Hausdorff dimension of the invariant measure is less than 1 but greater than 0.

entry.title: Hyperbolicity is dense in the real quadratic family
entry.summary: It is shown that for non-hyperbolic real quadratic polynomials topological and quasisymmetric conjugacy classes are the same. By quasiconformal rigidity, each class has only one representative in the quadratic family, which proves that hyperbolic maps are dense.

entry.title: On postcritically finite polynomials, part 2: Hubbard trees
entry.summary: We provide an effective classification of postcritically finite polynomials as dynamical systems by means of Hubbard Trees. This can be viewed as an application of the results developed in part 1 (Stony Brook IMS 1993/5).

entry.title: Non-accessible critical points of Cremer polynomials
entry.summary: It is shown that a polynomial with a Cremer periodic point has a non-accessible critical point in its Julia set provided that the Cremer periodic point is approximated by small cycles.

entry.title: Dynamics of quadratic polynomials: Complex bounds for real maps
entry.summary: We extend Sullivan's complex a priori bounds to real quadratic polynomials with essentially bounded combinatorics. Combined with the previous results of the first author, this yields complex bounds for all real quadratics. Local connectivity of the corresponding Julia sets follows.

entry.title: Necessity and Chance: deterministic chaos in ecology and evolution
entry.summary: This is an outline of my Gibbs Lecture to the American Mathematical Society in January 1994; it is essentially a sign-posted guide to a still-developing literature.

entry.title: The Boltzmann-Sinai Ergodic Hypothesis for Hard Ball Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due a crucial error.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to a crucial error

entry.title: The periodic points of renormalization
entry.summary: It will be shown that the renormalization operator, acting on the space of smooth unimodal maps with critical exponent greater than 1, has periodic points of any combinatorial type.

entry.title: Melnikov method for autonomous Hamiltonians
entry.summary: The web page contains both the dvi and postscript version of the paper. This paper presents the method of applying the Melnikov method to autonomous Hamiltonian systems in dimension four. Besides giving an application to Celestial Mechanics, it discusses the problem of convergence of the Melnikov function and the derivative of the Melnikov function.

entry.title: On critical points of proper holomorphic maps on the unit disk
entry.summary: We prove that a proper holomorphic map on the unit disk in the complex plane is uniquely determined up to post-composition with a Moebius transformation by its critical points.

entry.title: Universal models for Lorenz maps
entry.summary: The existence of smooth families of Lorenz maps exhibiting all possible dynamical behavior is established and the structure of the parameter space of these families is described.

entry.title: Asymptotic rigidity of scaling ratios for critical circle mappings
entry.summary: In this paper we establish $C^2$ a-priori bounds for the scaling ratios of critical circle mappings in a form that gives also a compactness property for the renormalization operator.

entry.title: Ergodicity of hard spheres in a box
entry.summary: We prove that the system of two hard balls in a $\nu$-dimensional ($\nu\ge2$) rectangular box is ergodic and, therefore, actually it is a Bernoulli flow.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems Vol. 19 (1999), pp. 741--766

entry.title: Bounded hyperbolic components of quadratic rational maps
entry.summary: Let ${\cal H}$ be a hyperbolic component of quadratic rational maps possessing two distinct attracting cycles. We show that ${\cal H}$ has compact closure in moduli space if and only if neither attractor is a fixed point.

entry.title: Rigidity of critical circle mappings, II
entry.summary: We prove that any two real-analytic critical circle maps with cubic critical point and the same irrational rotation number of bounded type are $C^{1+\alpha}$ conjugate for some $\alpha>0$.

entry.title: Biaccessiblility in quadratic Julia sets I: The locally-connected case
entry.summary: Let $f:z\mapsto z^2+c$ be a quadratic polynomial whose Julia set $J$ is locally-connected of the set of biaccessible points in $J$ is zero except when $f(z)=z^2-2$ is the Chebyshev quadratic polynomial for which the corresponding measure is one.

entry.title: Orbit equivalence and topological conjugacy of affine actions on compact abelian groups
entry.summary: In this paper we study topological rigidity of affine actions on compact connected metrizable abelian groups. We also classify one-parameter flows of translations upto orbit equivalence and discrete group actions by translations upto topological conjugacy.

entry.title: Contact reductions, mechanics and duality
entry.summary: Contact reduction is very closely related to symplectic reduction, but it allows symmetries that are not manifest in Hamiltonian mechanics and moreover, solution of the reduced problems yields solution of the original problem without further integration.

entry.title: Gradient like Morse-Smale dynamical systems on 4-manifolds
entry.summary: The complete invariant for gradient like Morse-Smale dynamical systems (vector fields and diffeomorphisms) on closed 4-manifolds are constructed. It is same as Kirby diagram in a case of polar vector field without fixed points of index 3.

entry.title: Flows on solenoids are generically not almost periodic
entry.summary: The space of non-singular flows on any given solenoid is shown to contain a generic subset consisting of flows that are not almost periodic. Whether this result carries over to Hamiltonian flows remains an open question.

entry.title: Visually building Smale flows in S3
entry.summary: A Smale flow is a structurally stable flow with one dimensional invariant sets. We use information from homology and template theory to construct, visualize and in some cases, classify, nonsingular Smale flows in the 3-sphere.

entry.title: A new class of positive recurrent functions
entry.summary: Recently O. Sarig has introduced and explored the concept of positively recurrent functions. In this paper we construct a natural wide class of such functions and we showthat they have stronger ergodic properties than the general functions considered in Sarig's paper.

entry.title: The Dynamics of Off-center Reflection
entry.summary: The dynamical properties, especially the symmetric orbits, of the 2-parameter family of circle maps called off-center reflection is studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 11 figures, AMS-LaTeX, revised version, no offset problem

entry.title: Topological rigidity of automorphism actions on nilmanifolds
entry.summary: Suppose $X_{1}, X_{2}$ are nilmanifolds and $\rho, \sigma$ are automorphism actions of a discrete group $\Gamma$ on $X_{1}$ and $X_{2}$ respectively. We show that if $(X_{1},\rho)$ and $(X_{2}, \sigma)$ satisfy certain additional conditions then every $\Gamma$-equivariant continuous map from $(X_{1},\rho)$ to $(X_{2},\sigma)$ is an affine map.

entry.title: A generalization of Hagopian's theorem and exponents
entry.summary: We generalize Hagopian's theorem characterizing solenoids to higher dimensions by showing that any homogeneous continuum admitting a fiber bundle projection onto a torus with totally disconnected fibers admits a compatible abelian topological group structure. The higher dimensional exponent group is then introduced.

entry.title: Expansiveness of algebraic actions on connected groups
entry.summary: We consider endomorphism actions of arbitrary discrete semigroups on a connected metrizable topological group G. We give necessary and sufficient conditions for expansiveness of such actions when G is a Lie group or a compact finite-dimensional group.

entry.title: Ergodicity of Mapping Class Group Actions on Representation Varieties, I. Closed Surfaces
entry.summary: We prove that the mapping class group of a closed surface acts ergodically on connected components of the representation variety corresponding to a connected compact Lie group.

entry.title: Systems of linear ordinary differential equations with bounded coefficients may have very oscillating solutions
entry.summary: An elementary example shows that the number of zeroes of a component of a solution of a system of linear ordinary differential equations cannot be estimated through the norm of coefficients of the system alone.

entry.title: Convergence or generic divergence of Birkhoff normal form
entry.summary: We prove that Birkhoff normal form of hamiltonian flows at a non-resonant singular point with given quadratic part are always convergent or generically divergent. The same result is proved for the normalization mapping and any formal first integral.

entry.title: The meromorphic non-integrability of the three-body problem
entry.summary: We study the planar three-body problem and prove the absence of a complete set of complex meromorphic first integrals in a neighborhood of the Lagrangian solution. We use the Ziglin's method and study the monodromy group of the corresponding normal variational equations.

entry.title: Novikov-Morse theory for dynamical systems
entry.summary: The present paper contains an interpretation and generalization of Novikov's theory of Morse type inequalities for 1-forms in terms of Conley's theory for dynamical systems.

entry.title: The Rotation Class of a Flow
entry.summary: Generalizing a construction of A. Weil, we introduce a topological invariant for flows on compact, connected, finite dimensional, abelian, topological groups. We calculate this invariant for some examples and compare the invariant with other flow invariants.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted for publication to Topology and its Applications

entry.title: Groups of homeomorphisms of one-manifolds, III: Nilpotent subgroups
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors; it will be incorporated into part I of the series (in preparation).

entry.title: Renormalization theory for multimodal maps
entry.summary: We study the dynamics of the renormalization operator for multimodal maps. In particular, we prove the exponential convergence of this operator for infinitely renormalizable maps with same bounded combinatorial type.

entry.title: Polynomial Diffeomorphisms of $\C^2$. VIII: Quasi-Expansion
entry.summary: This paper continues our investigation of the dynamics of polynomial diffeomorphisms of C^2. We introduce a dynamical property of polynomial diffeomorphisms that generalizes hyperbolicity in the way that semi-hyperbolicity generalizes hyperbolicity for polynomial maps of the complex plane.

entry.title: On measures of maximal and full dimension for polynomial automorphisms of $\C^2$
entry.summary: For a hyperbolic polynomial automorphism of $\C^2$, we show the existence of a measure of maximal dimension, and identify the conditions under which a measure of full dimension exists.

entry.title: Isomorphism rigidity of algebraic $Z^{d}$-actions
entry.summary: An algebraic $Z^{d}$-action is an action of $Z^{d}$ on a compact abelian group $X$ by automorphisms of $X$. We prove that for $d \ge 8$, there exist mixing zero entropy algebraic $Z^{d}$-actions which do not exhibit isomorphism rigidity property.

entry.title: Groups of diffeomorphisms of one-manifolds, III: Nilpotent subgroups
entry.summary: Plante-Thurston proved that every nilpotent subgroup of $\Diff^2(S^1)$ is abelian. One of our main results is a sharp converse: $\Diff^1(S^1)$ contains every finitely-generated, torsion-free nilpotent group.

entry.title: A complement to Hayashi Connecting Lemma
entry.summary: Here we show that for a C^2 surface diffeomorphism that satisfy the hypothesis of Hayashi connecting lemma either can be approximated, in the C^1 topology, by a diffeomorphism exhibiting a homoclinic tangency or the diffeomorphism already presented transversal homoclinic orbits.

entry.title: Remarks on Ruelle operator and Invariant Line Field Problem
entry.summary: In case of Lebesgue measure zero of postcritical set the necessary and sufficient conditions (in terms of convergence of sequences of measures) of existence of invariant conformal structures on J(R) are obtained.

entry.title: Remarks on Ruelle Operator and invariant line fields problem II
entry.summary: Let R be rational map. Critical point c is called summable if series $\sum_i\frac{1}{(R^i)'(R(c))}$ is absolutely convergent. Under some topological condition on postcritical set we prove that R can not be structurally stable if summable critical point $c \in J(R)$.

entry.title: Statistically self-similar fractal sets
entry.summary: In the present paper we define statistically self-similar sets, and, using a modification of method described K.J.Falconer find a Hausdorff dimension of a statistically self-similar set.

entry.title: A counterexample to the "composition conjecture"
entry.summary: In this note we construct a class of counterexamples to the "composition conjecture" concerning an infinitesimal version of the center problem for the polynomial Abel equation in the complex domain.

entry.title: Reduction and Integrability
entry.summary: We discuss the relationship between the integrability of a dynamical system invariant under a Lie group action and its reduced integrability, i.e. integrability of the corresponding reduced system.

entry.title: Characterizations of compactly almost periodic homeomorphisms of metrizable spaces
entry.summary: For metrizable spaces we replace the notion of almost periodic homeomorphism with a similar notion and verify that the usual characterizations of almost periodic homeomorphisms of compact metric spaces are valid for all metrizable spaces.

entry.title: Multicomponent dynamical systems: SRB measures and phase transitions
entry.summary: We discuss a notion of phase transitions in multicomponent systems and clarify relations between deterministic chaotic and stochastic models of this type of systems. Connections between various definitions of SRB measures are considered as well.

entry.title: Examples of Anosov diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: We give a simple procedure to construct explicit examples of nilmanifolds admitting an Anosov diffeomorphism, and show that a reasonable classification up to homeomorphism (or even up to commensurability) of such nilmanifolds would not be possible.

entry.title: A Non Conventional Ergodic Theorem for a Nil-System
entry.summary: We prove a non conventional pointwise convergence theorem for a nilsystem, and give an explicit formula for the limit.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems 25 (2005) no. 4 1357-1370

entry.title: Extensions, quotients and generalized pseudo-Anosov maps
entry.summary: We describe a circle of ideas relating the dynamics of 2-dimensional homeomorphisms to that of 1-dimensional endomorphisms. This is used to introduce a new class of maps generalizing that of Thurston's pseudo-Anosov homeomorphisms.

entry.title: Veech surfaces and complete periodicity in genus 2
entry.summary: We announce a classification of genus 2 Veech surfaces in the stratum with a single double zero. Furthermore, we classify all completely periodic translation surfaces in genus 2.

entry.title: Recurrence and lyapunov exponents
entry.summary: We prove two inequalities between the Lyapunov exponents of a diffeomorphism and its local recurrence properties. We give examples showing that each of the inequalities is optimal.

entry.title: Partial differentiability of invariant splittings
entry.summary: A key feature of a general nonlinear partially hyperbolic dynamical system is the absence of differentiability of its invariant splitting. In this paper, we show that often partial derivatives of the splitting exist and the splitting depends smoothly on the dynamical system itself.

entry.title: A Markov partition for the Feigenbaum dynamics
entry.summary: We build a Markov partition of the Feigenbaum dynamical plane, and a system of "external rays", which are invariant under rescaling. Applications to geometry of the Feigenbaum map are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: revised version, accepted by the journal Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems

entry.title: The Liouville-Arnold-Nekhoroshev theorem for non-compact invariant manifolds
entry.summary: Under ceratin conditions, generalized action-angle coordinates can be introduced near non-compact invariant manifolds of completely and partially integrable Hamiltonian systems.

entry.title: Note on the geometry of generalized parabolic towers
entry.summary: The goal of this technical note is to show that the geometry of generalized parabolic towers cannot be essentially bounded. It fills a gap in author's paper "Combinatorics, geomerty and attractors of quasi-quadratic maps", Annals of Math., 1992.

entry.title: On the geodesic flow of surfaces of nonpositive curvature
entry.summary: Let $S$ be a surface of nonpositive curvature of genus bigger than 1 (i.e. not the torus). We prove that any flat strip in the surface is in fact a flat cylinder. Moreover we prove that the number of homotopy classes of such flat cylinders is bounded.

entry.title: Sensitive dependence and dense perodic points
entry.summary: We show sensitive dependece on initial condition and dense periodic points imply asymptotic sensitivity, a stronger form of sensitivity, where the deviation happens not just once but infintely many times. As a consequence it follows that all Devaney chaotic systems (e.g. logistic map) have this property.

entry.title: Recurrence spectrum in smooth dynamical systems
entry.summary: We prove that for conformal expanding maps the return time does have constant multifractal spectrum. This is the counterpart of the result by Feng and Wu in the symbolic setting.

entry.title: Generic hyperbolicity for the equilibria of the one dimensional parabolic equation
entry.summary: We show, for some classes of diffusion coefficients that, generically in f, all equilibria of the reaction-diffusion equation u_t = (a(x)u_x)_x + f(u) with homogeneous Neumann boundary conditions are hyperbolic.

entry.title: Distortion growth for iterations of diffeomorphisms of the interval
entry.summary: We obtain several results on the distortion asymptotics for the iterations of diffeomorphisms of the interval extending the recent work of Polterovich and Sodin.

entry.title: Dynamics in two complex dimensions
entry.summary: We describe results on the dynamics of polynomial diffeomorphisms of ${\bf C^2}$ and draw connections with the dynamics of polynomial maps of ${\bf C}$ and the dynamics of polynomial diffeomorphisms of ${\bf R^2}$ such as the H\'enon family.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 373--382

entry.title: Mathematical modelling of the cardiovascular system
entry.summary: In this paper we will address the problem of developing mathematical models for the numerical simulation of the human circulatory system. In particular, we will focus our attention on the problem of haemodynamics in large human arteries.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 839--850

entry.title: Lemme de l'Ombre et non divergence des horosphères d'une variété géométriquement finie
entry.summary: In this work, we prove the so-called "Shadow lemma" on geometrically finite manifolds of variable negative curvature. We deduce a result of non divergence of the horospheres of such manifolds.

entry.title: Equidistribution des horocycles d'une surface géométriquement finie
entry.summary: In this work, we show equidistribution properties for the horocycles of a geometrically finite surface with variable negative curvature. If the surface is hyperbolic, we deduce an equidistribution result for the orbits of the horocyclic flow, when the surface has infinite volume.

entry.title: Ergodic amenable actions of algebraic groups
entry.summary: We prove that every ergodic amenable action of an algebraic group over a local field of characteristic zero is induced from an ergodic action of an amenable subgroup.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, to appear in Glasgow Mathematical Journal

entry.title: Recurrence and algorithmic information
entry.summary: In this paper we initiate a somewhat detailed investigation of the relationships between quantitative recurrence indicators and algorithmic complexity of orbits in weakly chaotic dynamical systems. We mainly focus on examples.

entry.title: Invariant measures for quasiperiodically forced circle homeomorphisms
entry.summary: We study invariant ergodic measures for quasiperiodically forced circle homeomorphisms and derive that either the system is uniquely ergodic or any such measure is associated to some invariant multigraph.

entry.title: On Hausdorff dimension of some Cantor attractors
entry.summary: We study what happens with the dimension of Feigenbaum-like attractors of smooth unimodal maps as the order of the critical point grows
entry.arxiv:comment: minor changes, accepted by the Israel Journal of Mathematics

entry.title: A note on stretched exponential decay of correlations for the Viana-Alves map
entry.summary: In this brief note, we prove stretched exponential upper bounds for the correlation functions of the absolutely continuous invariant measure of the skew product studied by Viana and Alves. This improves the superpolynomial bounds obtained by Alves, Luzzatto, and Pinheiro.

entry.title: Parameter-shifted shadowing property for geometric Lorenz attractors
entry.summary: In this paper, we will show that any geometric Lorenz flow in a definite class satisfies the parameter-shifted shadowing property.

entry.title: Topological method for symmetric periodic orbits for maps with a reversing symmetry
entry.summary: We present a topological method of obtaining the existence of infinite number of symmetric periodic orbits for systems with reversing symmetry. The method is based on covering relations. We apply the method to a four-dimensional reversible map.

entry.title: Rotor interaction in the annulus billiard
entry.summary: Introducing the rotor interaction in the integrable system of the annulus billiard produces a variety of dynamical phenomena, from integrability to ergodicity.

entry.title: On Lattès Maps
entry.summary: An exposition of the 1918 paper of Latt\`es, together with its historical antecedents, and its modern formulations and applications.

entry.title: Real Polynomial Diffeomorphisms with Maximal Entropy: II. Small Jacobian
entry.summary: This paper concerns the Henon family of diffeomorphisms of the plane for which the absolute value of the jacobian parameter is bounded by .08. We describe the parameter locus for which the mapping is a horseshoe.

entry.title: The non-adiabatic classical geometric phase and its bundle-theoretic interpretation
entry.summary: A bundle theoretic interpretation of the non-adiabatic classical geometric phase is given in the Koopman representation of dynamics

entry.title: Backward volume contraction for endomorphisms with eventual volume expansion
entry.summary: We consider smooth maps on compact Riemannian manifolds. We prove that under some mild condition of eventual volume expansion Lebesgue almost everywhere we have uniform backward volume contraction on every pre-orbit for Lebesgue almost every point.

entry.title: There are no structurally stable diffeomorphisms of odd-dimensional manifolds with codimension one non-orientable expanding attractors
entry.summary: We prove that a structurally stable diffeomorphism of a closed (2m+1)-manifold has no codimension one non-orientable expanding attractors.

entry.title: On arithmetical and dynamical properties of Lorentz maps of the torus
entry.summary: We proved that any Lorentz transformation of 2-torus is Anosov automorphism. One completely describes admissible parameters of Lorentz transformations and their arithmetical properties. One proved that an admissible speed light parameter has a countable spectra accumulating to this parameter.

entry.title: Homeomorphisms of UxR and rotation number
entry.summary: Despite a general lack of a useful 3 dimensional prime end theory, if h is a homeomorphism of the product of the real line R and the closure of a bounded open contractible planar set U, then h typically admits a notion of rotation number analogous to the usual one.

entry.title: Weak mixing for interval exchange transformations and translation flows
entry.summary: We show that a typical interval exchange transformation is either weakly mixing or it is an irrational rotation. We also conclude that a typical translation flow on a surface of genus $g \geq 2$ (with prescribed singularity types) is weakly mixing.

entry.title: Non-computable Julia sets
entry.summary: We show that under the definition of computability which is natural from the point of view of applications, there exist non-computable quadratic Julia sets.
entry.arxiv:comment: Updated version, to appear in JAMS

entry.title: An Index Interpretation For the Number Of Limit Cycles Of A Vector Field
entry.summary: We show that the number of limit cycles of Lienard vector field L is equal to the index of first order linear PDE defined by L.

entry.title: Switched flow systems: pseudo billiard dynamics
entry.summary: We study a class of dynamical systems which generalizes and unifies some models arising in the analysis of switched flow systems in manufacturing. General properties of these dynamical systems, called pseudo billiards, as well as some their perturbations are discussed.

entry.title: Periods for holomorphic maps via Lefschetz numbers
entry.summary: We characterise the set of fixed points of a class of holomorphic maps on complex manifolds with a prescribed homology. Our main tool is the Lefschetz number and the action of maps on the first homology group.

entry.title: Non rigidity of hyperbolic laminations
entry.summary: In this note we prove infinite dimensionality of the Teichm\"uller space of a hyperbolic Riemann surface lamination of a compact space having a simply connected leaf.

entry.title: Erratum to "Generalizations of the Poincaré-Birkhoff Theorem"
entry.summary: This is an erratum to an earlier paper, "Generalizations of the Poincar\'e-Birkhoff theorem." An error in the statement of one of the theorems is corrected.

entry.title: Filled Julia sets with empty interior are computable
entry.summary: We show that if a polynomial filled Julia set has empty interior, then it is computable.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is an expanded version, to appear in J. FoCM
