entry.title: Correct Solvability of Nonlinear Ordinary Differential Equations in Orlicz Spaces
entry.summary: We prove in this article the well posedness of non - linear Ordinary Differential Equations (ODE) of first and second order in Orlicz spaces with unbounded domain of definition.

entry.title: A Dichotomy between Discrete and Continuous Spectrum for a Class of Special Flows over Rotations
entry.summary: We provide sufficient conditions on a positive function so that its associated special flow over any irrational rotation is either weak mixing or $L^2$-conjugate to a suspension flow.

entry.title: A divergent Teichmuller geodesic with uniquely ergodic vertical foliation
entry.summary: We construct an example of a quadratic differential whose vertical foliation is uniquely ergodic and such that the Teichmuller geodesic determined by the quadratic differential diverges in the moduli space of Riemann surfaces.

entry.title: The Henon Family: The Complex Horseshoe Locus and Real Parameter Space
entry.summary: We consider the complexification of the Henon family of quadratic diffeomorphisms of the plane, and the region of parameter space corresponding to complex horseshoes. We discuss some conjectures about the global topology of the complex horseshoe locus.

entry.title: Stable manifolds under very weak hyperbolicity conditions
entry.summary: We present an argument for proving the existence of local stable and unstable manifolds in a general abstract setting and under very weak hyperbolicity conditions.

entry.title: On inverse problem of dynamics
entry.summary: We study the question whether for a natural Hamiltonian system on a two-dimensional compact configuration manifold, a single trajectory of sufficiently high energy is almost surely enough to reconstruct a real analytic potential.

entry.title: Always Finite Entropy and Lyapunov exponents of two-dimensional cellular automata
entry.summary: Given a new definition for the entropy of a cellular automata acting on a two-dimensional space, we propose an inequality between the entropy of the shift on a two-dimensional lattice and some angular analog of Lyapunov exponents.

entry.title: Regularity of coboundaries for non uniformly expanding Markov maps
entry.summary: We prove that solutions $u$ of the equation $f=u-u\circ T$ are automatically Holder continuous when $f$ is Holder continuous, and $T$ is non uniformly expanding and Markov. This result applies in particular to Young towers and to intermittent maps.

entry.title: Convergence to equilibrium for intermittent symplectic maps
entry.summary: We investigate a class of area preserving non-uniformly hyperbolic maps of the two torus. First we establish some results on the regularity of the invariant foliations, then we use this knowledge to estimate the rate of mixing.

entry.title: Enveloppe galoisienne d'une application rationnelle de P1
entry.summary: The D-envelope (or galoisian envelope) of rational endomorphisms of P1 are computed. One obtain the following theorem : "the rational transformations of P1 with an invariant meromorphic G-structure are the integrables ones."

entry.title: On the adiabatic perturbation theory for systems with impacts
entry.summary: We justify an applicability of the adiabatic perturbation theory for three well known systems with impacts: a ball between two slowly moving walls, a slowly irregular waveguide, and an adiabatic piston.

entry.title: Divergent Square Averages
entry.summary: We answer a question of J. Bourgain. We show that the sequence n^2 is L^1-universally bad.

author.name: R. Daniel Mauldin
author.arxiv:affiliation: University of North Texas, Denton, TX

entry.title: Monotone periodic orbits for torus homeomorphisms
entry.summary: Let f be a homeomorphism of the torus isotopic to the identity and suppose that there exists a periodic orbit with a non-zero rotation vector (p/q,r/q), then f has a topologically monotone periodic orbit with the same rotation vector.

entry.title: Parameter rays for the exponential family
entry.summary: We investigate the set of parameters $\kappa\in\C$ for which the singular orbit $(0,e^{\kappa},...)$ of $E_{\kappa}(z):=\exp(z+\kappa)$ converges to $\infty$. These parameters are organized in smooth curves in parameter space called \emph{parameter rays}.

entry.title: On the structure of the singularity manifolds of dispersing billiards
entry.summary: In this paper we study the singularity manifolds of multidimensional strictly dispersing billiards and show that the proof of the Fundamental theorem for dispersing billiards remain valid for a dense set of finitely smooth scatterers.

entry.title: Affability of equivalence relations arising from two-dimensional substitution tilings
entry.summary: We will show that an equivalence relation on a Cantor set arising from a two-dimensional substitution tiling by polygons is affable in the sense of Giordano, Putnam and Skau.

entry.title: Examples of quasi-hyperbolic dynamical systems with slow decay of correlations
entry.summary: We give examples of quasi-hyperbolic dynamical systems with the following properties : polynomial decay of correlations, convergence in law toward a non gaussian law of the ergodic sums (divided by $n^{3/4}$) associated to non degenerated regular functions.

entry.title: On the nonexistence of fat partially hyperbolic horseshoes
entry.summary: We show that there are no partially hyperbolic horseshoes with positive Lebesgue measure for diffeomorphisms whose class of differentiability is higher than 1. This generalizes a classical result by Bowen for uniformly hyperbolic horseshoes.

entry.title: The Julia set for Henon maps
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the support of the unique measure of maximal entropy of complex Henon maps, J^*. The main question is whether this set is the same as the analogue of the Julia set, J.

entry.title: Semi-continuity of Siegel disks under parabolic implosion
entry.summary: We transfer the lower semi-continuity of Siegel disks with fixed Brjuno type rotation numbers to geometric limits. Here, we restrict to Lavaurs maps associated to quadratic polynomials with a parabolic fixed point.

entry.title: On Dynamical Systems With Slow Recurrence Time
entry.summary: Using a result of Behrend concerning sets without arithmetic progressions, we construct some examples of dynamical systems with slow time of multiple recurrence. Our theorem is a quatitative analog of Furstenberg's Correspondence Principle.

entry.title: About a conjecture for uniformly isochronous polynomial centers
entry.summary: We study a specific family of uniformly isochronous polynomial systems. Our results permit to solve a problem about centers of such systems.

entry.title: Holomorphic Motions and Normal Forms in Complex Analysis
entry.summary: We give a brief review of holomorphic motions and its relation with quasiconformal mapping theory. Furthermore, we apply the holomorphic motions to give new proofs of famous Konig's Theorem and Bottcher's Theorem in classical complex analysis.

entry.title: A lambda-lemma for normally hyperbolic invariant manifolds
entry.summary: Let $N$ be a smooth manifold and $f:N\to N$ be a $C^l$, $l\geq 2$ diffeomorphism. Let $M$ be a normally hyperbolic invariant manifold, not necessarily compact. We prove an analogue of the $\lambda$-lemma in this case.

entry.title: On the Ergodic Properties of Certain Additive Cellular Automata over $Z_{m}$
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate some ergodic properties of $Z^{2}$-actions $T_{p,n}$ generated by an additive cellular automata and shift acting on the space of all doubly -infinitive sequences taking values in $Z_{m}$.

entry.title: Entropy production in Gaussian thermostats
entry.summary: We show that an arbitrary Anosov Gaussian thermostat on a surface is dissipative unless the external field has a global potential.

entry.title: Metric attractors for smooth unimodal maps
entry.summary: We classify the measure theoretic attractors of general C^3 unimodal maps with quadratic critical points. The main ingredient is the decay of geometry.

entry.title: The only syzygy-free solution is Lagrange's
entry.summary: A syzygy in the three-body problem is a collinear instant. We prove that with the exception of Lagrange's solution every solution to the zero angular momentum Newtonian three-body problem suffers syzygies. The proof works for all mass ratios.

entry.title: Universally L^1 good sequences with gaps tending to infinity
entry.summary: A universally L^1 good sequence n_k is constructed with n_{k+1}-n_k tending to infinity. For ergodic transformations non-conventional ergodic averages of L^1 functions computed by using this sequence converge to the integral of the function.

entry.title: Hyperboliity versus partial-hyperbolicity and the transversality-torsion phenomenon
entry.summary: In this paper, we describe a process to create hyperbolicity in the neighbourhood of a homoclinic orbit to a partially hyperbolic torus for three degrres of freedom Hamiltonian systems: the transversality-torsion phenomenon.

entry.title: Normalizers of planar systems with known first integrals
entry.summary: Given a planar differential system with a first integral, we show how to find a normalizer. For systems with a center, we give an integral formula for the derivative of its period function.

entry.title: On Raw Coding of Chaotic Dynamics
entry.summary: We study raw coding of trajectories of a chaotic dynamical system by sequences of elements from a finite alphabet and show that there is a fundamental constraint on differences between codes corresponding to different trajectories of the dynamical system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, to appear in ``Problems of Information Transmission''

entry.title: More simple proofs of Sharkovsky's theorem
entry.summary: Recently we have obtained two simple proofs of Sharkovsky's theorem, one with directed graphs [7] and the other without [8]. In this note, we present yet more simple proofs of Sharkovsky's theorem.

entry.title: Mixing of asymmetric logarithmic suspension flows over interval exchange transformations
entry.summary: We consider suspension flows built over interval exchange transformations with the help of roof functions having an asymmetric logarithmic singularity. We prove that such flows are strongly mixing for a full measure set of interval exchange transformations.

entry.title: On computability of Julia sets: answers to questions of Milnor and Shub
entry.summary: In this note we give answers to questions posed to us by J.Milnor and M.Shub, which shed further light on the structure of non-computable Julia sets.

entry.title: Constructing Non-Computable Julia Sets
entry.summary: We completely characterize the conformal radii of Siegel disks in the family $$P_\theta(z)=e^{2\pi i\theta}z+z^2,$$ corresponding to {\bf computable} parameters $\theta$. As a consequence, we constructively produce quadratic polynomials with {\bf non-computable} Julia sets.

entry.title: The lives of period-3 orbits for some quadratic polynomials
entry.summary: In this note, we consider the following two families of quadratic polynomials $S_{a,c}(x) = a - cx^2$ and $T_{a,c}(x) = a - c(1 + x^2)$ and show that their respective period-3 orbits live very different lives.

entry.title: On a recursive equation over $p$-adic field
entry.summary: In the paper we completely describe the set of all solutions of a recursive equation, arising from the Bethe lattice models over $p$-adic numbers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages. Appear in Appl. Math. Lett

entry.title: Recurrent Motions in the Nonautonomous Navier-Stokes System
entry.summary: We prove the existence of recurrent or Poisson stable motions in the Navier-Stokes fluid system under recurrent or Poisson stable forcing, respectively. We use an approach based on nonautonomous dynamical systems ideas.

entry.title: Construction of foliations with prescribed separatrix
entry.summary: We build a germ of singular foliation in dimension two with analytical class of separatrix and holonomy representations prescribed. Thanks to this construction, we study the link between moduli of a foliation and moduli of its separatrix.

entry.title: An Algorithm for Detecting "Linear" Solutions of Nonlinear Polynomial Differential Equations
entry.summary: A symbolic computational algorithm which detects " linear "` solutions of nonlinear polynomial differential equations of single functions, is developed throughout this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, submitted to Applied Mathematics Electronic Notes

entry.title: Orthogonal Asymptotic Lines on Surfaces Immersed in $\mathbf R ^4$
entry.summary: In this paper we study some properties of surfaces immersed in $\mathbf R ^4$ whose asymptotic lines are orthogonal. We also analyze necessary and sufficient conditions for the hypersphericity of surfaces in $\mathbf R ^4$.

entry.title: Dimension estimates for invariant measures of contracting-on-average iterated function systems
entry.summary: We estimate from above and below the dimension of invariant measure for contracting-on-average iterated function systems in $\R^d$.

entry.title: Fixed Points of abelian actions
entry.summary: We prove that if $\F$ is an abelian group of $C^1$ diffeomorphisms isotopic to the identity of a closed surface $S$ of genus at least two then there is a common fixed point for all elements of $\F.$

entry.title: Periodic orbits in outer billiards
entry.summary: It is shown that the set of 4-period orbits in outer billiard with piecewise smooth convex boundary has an empty interior, provided that no four corners of the boundary form a parallelogram.

entry.title: Analysis of a 3D chaotic system
entry.summary: A 3D nonlinear chaotic system, called the T system, is analyzed in this paper. Horseshoe chaos is investigated via the heteroclinic Shilnikov method constructing a heteroclinic connections between the saddle equilibrium points of the system. Partially numerical computations are carried out to support the analytical results.

entry.title: A priori bounds for some infinitely renormalizable quadratics: I. Bounded primitive combinatorics
entry.summary: We prove the a priori bounds for infinitely renormalizable quadratic polynomials of bounded primitive type. This implies the local connectivity of the Mandelbrot set at the corresponding points.

entry.title: Uniform Periodic Point Growth in Entropy Rank One
entry.summary: We show that algebraic dynamical systems with entropy rank one have uniformly exponentially many periodic points in all directions.

entry.title: Global rigidity of certain abelian actions by toral automorphisms
entry.summary: We prove global rigidity results for some linear abelian actions on tori. The type of actions we deal with includes in particular maximal rank semisimple actions on $\T^N$.

entry.title: Schwarzian Derivatives and Cylinder Maps
entry.summary: We describe the way in which the sign of the Schwarzian derivative for a family of diffeomorphisms of the interval $I$ affects the dynamics of an associated many-to-one skew product map of the cylinder $(\R/\Z)\times I$.

entry.title: A hyperbolic diffeomorphism with countably many ergodic components near identity
entry.summary: We construct a smooth hyperbolic volume preserving diffeomorphism on a four dimensional compact Riemannian manifold which has countably many ergodic components and is arbitrarily close to the identity map.

entry.title: On Periodic Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate the existence and the global stability of periodic solution for dynamical systems with periodic interconnections, inputs and self-inhibitions. The model is very general, the conditions are quite weak and the results obtained are universal.

entry.title: Parabolic curves for diffeomorphisms in (C^2,0)
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of existence of parabolic curves for tangent to the identity diffeomorphisms in (C^2,0) with isolated fixed point.

entry.title: Maharam Extension for Nonsingular Group Actions
entry.summary: We establish a generalization of the Maharam Extension Theorem to nonsingular group actions. We also present an extension of Krengel Representation Theorem of dissipative transformations to nonsingular actions.

entry.title: Vertices of Mather's Beta function, II
entry.summary: If the $\beta$-function of a time-periodic Lagrangian on a manifold $M$ has a vertex at a $k$-irrational homology class $h$, then $2k \leq \dim M$. Furthermore if $\dim M =2$ $h$ is rational.

entry.title: On Cr-closing for flows on orientable and non-orientable 2-manifolds
entry.summary: We provide an affirmative answer to the Cr Closing Lemma, r>1, for a large class of flows defined on every closed surface.

entry.title: Analytical and formal classifications of quasi-homogeneous foliations in (C^2,0)
entry.summary: We prove a result of classification for germs of formal and convergent quasi-homogeneous foliations in C^2 with fixed separatrix. Basically, we prove that the analytical and formal class of such a foliation depend respectively only on the analytical and formal class of its representation of projective holonomy.

entry.title: Rational Misiurewicz maps are rare
entry.summary: We show that the set of Misiurewicz maps has Lebesgue measure zero in the parameter space of rational maps for any fixed degree greater than or equal to 2.

entry.title: Denseness of ergodicity for a class of partially hyperbolic volume-preserving flows
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to a mistake in one of the proofs

entry.title: Hilbert's 16th Problem for Quadratic Systems. New Methods Based on a Transformation to the Lienard Equation
entry.summary: Fractionally-quadratic transformations which reduce any two-dimensional quadratic system to the special Lienard equation are introduced. Existence criteria of cycles are obtained.

entry.title: Formal Paths, Iterated Integrals and the Center Problem for Ordinary Differential Equations
entry.summary: We continue the study of the center problem for the ordinary differential equation $v'=\sum_{i=1}^{\infty}a_{i}(x)v^{i+1}$ started in our earlier papers. In this paper we present the highlights of the algebraic theory of centers.

entry.title: Pattern equivariant functions, deformations and equivalence of tiling spaces
entry.summary: We reinvestigate the theory of deformations of tilings using P-equivariant cohomology. In particular we relate the notion of asymptotically negligible shape functions introduced by Clark and Sadun to weakly P-equivariant forms. We then investigate more closely the relation between deformations of patterns and homeomorphism or topological conjugacy of pattern spaces.

entry.title: Approximation of Partially Smooth Functions
entry.summary: In this paper we discuss approximation of partially smooth functions. The problem arises naturally in the study of laminated currents.

entry.title: Planar Embeddings with a Globally Attracting Fixed Point
entry.summary: We consider sufficient conditions which guarantee that a planar embedding has a unique fixed point. We study sufficient conditions which imply the appearing of a globally attracting fixed point for such an embedding.

entry.title: Piecewise linear homeomorphisms of the real line
entry.summary: Brin and Squier described how to classify the elements of the group of piecewise linear homeomorphisms of the real line according to conjugacy. We supply a short account of the key step in their classification. The results in this document are unoriginal. The proofs are a little sketchy in places.

entry.title: On Multiple and Polynomial Recurrent extensions of infinite measure preserving transformations
entry.summary: We prove that multiple-recurrence and polynomial-recurrence of invertible infinite measure preserving transformations are both properties which pass to extensions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages. Replaces "Extensions and Multiple Recurrence of infinite measure preserving systems", plus a result about polynomial recurrence

entry.title: Working with 2s and 3s
entry.summary: We establish an equivalent condition to the validity of the Collatz conjecture, using elementary methods. We derive some conclusions and show several examples of our results. We also offer a variety of exercises, problems and conjectures.

entry.title: A new class of rank one transformations with singular spectrum
entry.summary: We introduce a new tool to study the spectral type of rank one transformations using the method of central limit theorem for trigonometric sums. We get some new applications.

entry.title: Ergodic Theory: Recurrence
entry.summary: We survey the impact of the Poincar\'e recurrence principle in ergodic theory, especially as pertains to the field of ergodic Ramsey theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: Final version. To appear in the Encyclopedia of Complexity and System Science

entry.title: Geometry of limit sets for expansive Markov systems
entry.summary: We describe the geometric and dynamical properties of expansive Markov systems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, 1 figure; Replaced with revised version, Accepted for publication in Trans. Amer. Math. Soc

entry.title: Local dynamics for fibered holomorphic transformations
entry.summary: Fibered holomorphic dynamics are skew-product transformations over an irrational rotation, whose fibers are holomorphic functions. In this paper we study such a dynamics on a neighborhood of an invariant curve. We obtain some results analogous to the results in the non fibered case.

entry.title: A few brief comments on the results of manuscript arXiv:math/0405153v3
entry.summary: The results in the recently posted manuscript arXiv:math/0405153v3 are incorrect. The correct version of the aimed results is not original. The preprint contains material from references that are not properly quoted.

entry.title: Measure of full dimension for some nonconformal repellers
entry.summary: We prove the existence of an ergodic measure with full Hausdorff dimension for a class of nonlinear nonconformal skew-product transformations. In order to do so we establish a variational principle for the topological pressure of certain noncompact sets.

entry.title: Flocking in noisy environments
entry.summary: We consider a perturbed version of the dynamics of a flock introduced by Cucker and Smale ("Emergent behaviour in flocks") and prove, under similar conditions, that nearly-alignment (a concept that is precised in the text) is achieved with a certain probability, bounded from below.

entry.title: How much information about a dynamical system do its recurrences contain?
entry.summary: We show that, under suitable assumptions, Poincare recurrences of a dynamical system determine its topology in phase space. Therefore, dynamical systems with the same recurrences are topologically equivalent.

entry.title: Hausdorff Dimension and Hausdorff Measure for Non-integer based Cantor-type Sets
entry.summary: We consider digits-deleted sets or Cantor-type sets with $\beta$-expansions. We calculate the Hausdorff dimension $d$ of these sets and show that $d$ is continuous with respect to $\beta$. The $d$-dimentional Hausdorff measure of these sets is finite and positive.

entry.title: On the zero-temperature limit of one-dimensional Gibbs measures
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to an error in the main theorem.

entry.title: Minimal geodesics and topological entropy on T^2
entry.summary: Let (T^2, g) be a two-dimensional Riemannian torus. In this paper we prove that the topological entropy of the geodesic flow restricted to the set of initial conditions of minimal geodesics vanishes, independent of the choice of the Riemannian metric.

entry.title: Semigroups on Frechet spaces and equations with infinite delays
entry.summary: In this paper, we show existence and uniqueness of a solution to a functional differential equation with infinite delay. We choose an appropriate Frechet space so as to cover a large class of functions to be used as initial functions to obtain existence and uniqueness of solutions.

entry.title: On C1-robust transitivity of volume-preserving flows
entry.summary: We prove that a divergence-free and C1-robustly transitive vector field has no singularities. Moreover, if the vector field is C4 then the linear Poincare flow associated to it admits a dominated splitting over M.

entry.title: Regularity of some class of nonlinear transformations
entry.summary: In this paper we consider quadratic stochastic operators designed on finite Abelian groups. It is proved that such operators have the property of regularity.

entry.title: Analyse harmonique sur le graphe de Pascal
entry.summary: We prove a spectral decomposition theorem for a well-known self-similar graph, for some finite graphs which are quotients of this graph and for a compactification of it.

entry.title: Resonances and O-curves in Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We investigate the problem of the existence of trajectories asymptotic to elliptic equilibria of Hamiltonian systems in the presence of resonances.

entry.title: Lyapunov Coefficients for Degenerate Hopf Bifurcations
entry.summary: In this paper are studied the codimensions one, two, three and four Hopf bifurcations and the pertinent Lyapunov stability coefficients. Algebraic expressions obtained with computer assisted calculations are displayed.

entry.title: The Number of Periodic Orbits of a Rational Difference Equation
entry.summary: We show how a variant of the Lefschetz Fixed Point Theorem may be used to count the number of periodic orbits for certain rational difference equations.

entry.title: Linear Recurrences in the Degree Sequences of Monomial Mappings
entry.summary: Let $A$ be an integer matrix, and let $f_A$ be the associated monomial map. We give a connection between the eigenvalues of $A$ and existence of a linear recurrence relation in the sequence of degrees.

entry.title: Dynamical systems with double recursion are undecidable
entry.summary: A primitive type of two-dimensional dynamic system is introduced. It is shown that there is no decision procedure able to answer if such a dynamical system is ultimately zero.

entry.title: Equicontinuous Geodesic Flows
entry.summary: The author shows that equicontinuous geodesic flows on surfaces are periodic. A similar result for flows on 3-manifolds is also proven. The idea of the proof is to show that the return map is recurrent and therefore periodic.

entry.title: The Dynamics of Rabinovich system
entry.summary: The paper presents some dynamical aspects of Rabinovich type, with distributed delay and with fractional derivatives.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, 2 figures, Conference on Differential Geometry-Dynamical Systems(DGDS-2007), October, 5-7, Bucharest, Romania

entry.title: Idempotent ultrafilters and polynomial recurrence
entry.summary: We give a new proof of a polynomial recurrence result due to Bergelson, Furstenberg, and McCutcheon, using idempotent ultrafilters instead of IP-limits.

entry.title: Conformal Graph Directed Markov Systems
entry.summary: We present the main concepts and results for Graph Directed Markov Systems that have a finitely irreducible incidence matrix. We then see how these results change when the incidence matrix is not assumed to be finitely irreducible.

entry.title: Parabolic Iterated Function Systems with Applications to the Backward Continued Fractions
entry.summary: To the Renyi or backward continued fraction transformation we associate a parabolic iterated function system whose limit set has Hausdorff dimension 1. We show that the Texan Conjecture holds, i.e. for every t in1] there exists a subsystem whose limit set has Hausdorff dimension t

entry.title: On the Hausdorff Dimension of the Mather Quotient
entry.summary: Under appropriate assumptions on the dimension of the ambient manifold and the regularity of the Hamiltonian, we show that the Mather quotient is small in term of Hausdorff dimension. Then, we present applications in dynamics.

entry.title: Newhouse phenomenon and homoclinic classes
entry.summary: We show that for a $C^1$ residual subset of diffeomorphisms far away from tangency, every non-trivial chain recurrent class that is accumulated by sources ia a homoclinic class contains periodic points with index 1 and it's the Hausdorff limit of a family of sources.

entry.title: Lyapunov stable chain recurrent classes
entry.summary: We show that for a $C^1$ residual subset of diffeomorphisms far away from homoclinic tangency, the stable manifolds of periodic points cover a dense subset of the ambient manifold. This gives a partial proof to a conjecture of C. Bonatti.

entry.title: Enhanced delay to Bifurcation
entry.summary: This article provides an example of fast-slow system such that most orbits remain as close as possible to the unstable manifold of the fast dynamics for an arbitrarily long time.

entry.title: A Lohner-type algorithm for control systems and ordinary differential inclusions
entry.summary: We describe a Lohner-type algorithm for the computation of rigorous upper bounds for reachable set for control systems, solutions of ordinary differential inclusions and perturbations of ODEs.

entry.title: Cubic polynomials with a parabolic point
entry.summary: We consider the family of cubic polynomials with a simple parabolic fixed point. We prove that the boundary of the immediate basin of attraction of the parabolic point is a Jordan curve and give a description of the dynamics.

entry.title: On one polynomial $p$-adic dynamical system
entry.summary: In the paper we describe basin of attraction and the Siegel discs of the $p$-adic dynamical system $f(x)=x^{2n+1}+ax^{n+1}$ over complex $p$-adic field.

entry.title: Self-similar tiling systems, topological factors and stretching factors
entry.summary: In this paper we prove that if two self-similar tiling systems, with respective stretching factors $\lambda_1$ and $\lambda_2$, have a common factor which is a non periodic tiling system, then $\lambda_1$ and $\lambda_2$ are multiplicatively dependent.

entry.title: Cobham-Semenov theorem and $\NN^d$-subshifts
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the Cobham's first theorem using ideas from symbolic dynamics and of the Cobham-Semenov theorem (in the primitive case) using ideas from tiling dynamics.

entry.title: Degree complexity of a family of birational maps: II. Exceptional cases
entry.summary: We compute the degree complexity of the family of birational maps considered in \cite{bedford-kim-tuyen-abarenkova-maillard} for all exceptional cases. Some interesting properties of the family are also given.

entry.title: No Finite Invariant Density for Misiurewicz Exponential Maps
entry.summary: For exponential mappings such that the orbit of the only singular value 0 is bounded, it is shown that no integrable density invariant under the dynamics exists on the complex plane.

entry.title: On existence and uniqueness of the carrying simplex for competitive dynamical systems
entry.summary: Certain dynamical models of competition have a unique invariant hypersurface to whichevery nonzero tractory is asymptotic, having simple geometry and topology.
entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to Journal of Biological Dynamics. 13 pages

entry.title: Recurrence times and large deviations
entry.summary: We give a criterion to determine the large deviation rate functions for abstract dynamical systems on towers. As an application of this criterion we show the level 2 large deviation principle for some class of smooth interval maps with nonuniform hyperbolicity.

entry.title: Two versions of a specific natural extension
entry.summary: We give two versions of the natural extension of a specific greedy beta-transformation with deleted digits. We use the natural extension to obtain an explicit expression for the invariant measure, equivalent to the Lebesgue measure, of this beta-transformation.

entry.title: Explicit a priori bounds on transfer operator eigenvalues
entry.summary: We provide explicit bounds on the eigenvalues of transfer operators defined in terms of holomorphic data.

entry.title: On the Ruelle eigenvalue sequence
entry.summary: For certain real analytic data, we show that the eigenvalue sequence of the associated transfer operator L is insensitive to the holomorphic function space on which L acts. Explicit bounds on this eigenvalue sequence are established.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, to appear in Ergod. Th. & Dyn. Sys.

entry.title: On the Scarf-Hirota model in the price-scaled price adjustment process
entry.summary: Hirota's results given in (Hirota.M.,1981) on the asymptotically stability are generalized to the price-scaled price adjustment process.

entry.title: Equality of pressures for diffeomorphisms preserving hyperbolic measures
entry.summary: For a diffeomorphism which preserves a hyperbolic measure the potential $\phi^u=-\log|{\rm Jac} df|_{E^u}|$ is studied. Various types of pressure of $\phi^u$ are introduced. It is shown that these pressures satisfy a corresponding variational principle.
entry.arxiv:comment: Accepted for publication in Mathematische Nachrichten

entry.title: Strong law of large numbers with concave moments
entry.summary: In this note not intended for publication, it is observed that a wellnigh trivial application of the ergodic theorem of Karlsson-Ledrappier yields a strong LLN for arbitrary concave moments.

entry.title: Dynamic Physical Systems: Energy Balances and Stability Issues
entry.summary: This paper discusses some links properties of operators with the well- known physical concepts of hyperstability, passivity, energy dissipativeness and conservativeness with positive realness properties of the transfer functions in linear dynamic systems.

entry.title: Stability of Delayed Systems Modeled by Fractional Models
entry.summary: The paper discusses linear fractional representations of parameter-dependent nonlinear systems with dynamics defined by real rational nonlinearities and a finite set of point delays. The global asymptotic stability is investigated via linear matrix inequalities.

entry.title: Limit sets and a problem in dynamical systems
entry.summary: We approximate a chain recurrent dynamical system by periodic dynamical systems. This is similar to the well known Bohr theorem on approximation of almost periodic functions by periodic functions.

entry.title: The C1 generic diffeomorphism has trivial centralizer
entry.summary: Answering a question of Smale, we prove that the space of C1 diffeomorphisms of a compact manifold contains a residual subset of diffeomorphisms whose centralizers are trivial.

entry.title: A General Correspondence between Averages and Integrals
entry.summary: Recent work has generalized the Furstenberg correspondence between sets of integers and dynamical systems to versions which involve sequences of finite graphs or sequences of $L^\infty$ functions. We give a unified version of the theorem subsuming all these generalizations.

entry.title: A nonlinear inequality
entry.summary: A quadratic inequality is formulated in the paper. An estimate on the rate of decay of solutions to this inequality is obtained. This inequality is of interest in a study of dynamical systems and nonlinear evolution equations.

entry.title: Analytic multiplicative cocycles over holomorphic dynamical systems
entry.summary: We prove some properties of analytic multiplicative and sub-multiplicative cocycles. The results allow to construct natural invariant analytic sets associated to complex dynamical systems.

entry.title: A theorem of Tits type for compact Kahler manifolds
entry.summary: We prove a theorem of Tits type about automorphism groups for compact Kahler manifolds, which has been conjectured in the paper [KOZ].

entry.title: Quasi-periodic solutions of nonlinear random Schrödinger equations
entry.summary: We construct quasi-periodic solutions to the lattice nonlinear random Schroedinger equation on a set of potentials of positive measure via using a Lyapunov-Schmidt decomposition and a multiscale Newton scheme.

entry.title: Pairs of periodic orbits with fixed homology difference
entry.summary: We obtain an asymptotic formula for the number of pairs of closed orbits of a weak-mixing transitive Anosov flow whose homology classes have a fixed difference.

entry.title: On the definition of L2-Betti numbers of equivalence relations
entry.summary: We show that the L2-Betti numbers of equivalence relations defined by R. Sauer coincide with those defined by D. Gaboriau.

entry.title: Perturbation d'un hamiltonien partiellement hyperbolique
entry.summary: Arnold's diffusion in quasi integrable hamiltonian systems occurs in exponentially large time. We study an initially hyperbolic system which admits diffusion in polynomial time.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Comptes Rendus de l Acad\'emie des Sciences - Series I - Mathematics 323 (1996) 00

entry.title: Linearly repetitive Delone systems have a finite number of non periodic Delone system factors
entry.summary: We prove linearly repetitive Delone systems have finitely many Delone system factors up to conjugacy. This result is also applicable to linearly repetitive tiling systems.

entry.title: An application of Jacquet-Langlands correspondence to transfer operators for geodesic flows on Riemann surfaces
entry.summary: In the paper as a new application of the Jacquet-Langlands correspondence we connect the transfer operators for different cofinite Fuchsian groups by comparing the corresponding Selberg zeta functions.

entry.title: An interval map with a spectral gap on Lipschitz functions, but not on bounded variation functions
entry.summary: We construct a uniformly expanding map of the interval, preserving Lebesgue measure, such that the corresponding transfer operator admits a spectral gap on the space of Lipschitz functions, but does not act continuously on the space of bounded variation functions.

entry.title: Non-degenerate quadratic laminations
entry.summary: We give a combinatorial criterion for a critical diameter to be compatible with a non-degenerate quadratic lamination.

entry.title: Lyapunov spectrum for rational maps
entry.summary: We study the dimension spectrum of Lyapunov exponents for rational maps on the Riemann sphere.

entry.title: The Euler class of planar groups
entry.summary: This is an exposition of the homological classification of actions of surface groups on the plane, in every degree of smoothness.

entry.title: The absolutely continuous spectrum of the almost Mathieu operator
entry.summary: We prove that the spectrum of the almost Mathieu operator is absolutely continuous if and only if the coupling is subcritical. This settles Problem 6 of Barry Simon's list of Schr\"odinger operator problems for the twenty-first century.

entry.title: Hydrodynamics, probability and the geometry of the diffeomorphisms group
entry.summary: We characterize the solution of Navier-Stokes equation as a stochastic geodesic on the diffeomorphisms group, thus generalizing Arnold's description of the Euler flow.

entry.title: A few things I learnt from Jurgen Moser
entry.summary: A few remarks on integrable dynamical systems inspired by discussions with Jurgen Moser and by his work.
entry.arxiv:comment: An article for the special issue of "Regular and Chaotic Dynamics" dedicated to 80-th anniversary of Jurgen Moser

entry.title: Infinite genus surfaces and irrational polygonal billiards
entry.summary: We prove that the natural invariant surface associated with the billiard game on an irrational polygonal table is homeomorphic to the Loch Ness monster, that is, the only orientable infinite genus topological real surface with exactly one end.

entry.title: The Julia set of a post-critically finite endomorphism of PC^2
entry.summary: We construct a combinatorial model of the Julia set of the endomorphism $f(z, w)=((1-2z/w)^2, (1-2/w)^2)$ of $PC^2$.

entry.title: Convergence of multiple ergodic averages along cubes for several commuting transformations
entry.summary: We prove the norm convergence of multiple ergodic averages along cubes for several commuting transformations, and derive corresponding combinatorial results. The method we use relies primarily on the "magic extension" established recently by B. ~Host.

entry.title: The escaping set of the exponential
entry.summary: We show that the points that converge to infinity under iteration of the exponential map form a connected subset of the complex plane.

entry.title: The Lyapunov spectrum is not always concave
entry.summary: We characterize one-dimensional compact repellers having nonconcave Lyapunov spectra. For linear maps with two branches we give an explicit condition that characterizes non-concave Lyapunov spectra.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Statistical Physics vol.135 no.3, 535-546 (2009)

entry.title: Multiparameter ergodic averages for two commuting actions of an amenable group
entry.summary: We find limits of some multiple ergodic averages, generalizing a result of Bergelson to the setting of two commuting transformations and actions of amenable groups.

entry.title: Zero entropy invariant measures for some skew product diffeomorphisms
entry.summary: In this paper we study some skew product diffeomorphisms with nonuniformly hyperbolic structure along fibers. We show that there is an invariant measure with zero entropy which has atomic conditional measures along fibers.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, submitted to Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems

entry.title: On the entropy for group actions on the circle
entry.summary: We show that for a finitely generated group of $C^2$ circle diffeomorphisms, the entropy of the action equals the entropy of the restriction of the action to the non-wandering set.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. To appear in Fundamenta Math

entry.title: On the centers of the weight-homogeneous polynomial vector fields on the plane
entry.summary: We classify all the centers of a planar weight-homogeneous polynomial vector field of weight degree 1, 2, 3 and 4.

entry.title: A brief remark on orbits of $SL(2,Z)$ in the euclidean plane
entry.summary: The repartition of dense orbits of $\textrm{SL}(2,\dr Z)$ in the euclidean plane is described by Ledrappier and Nogueira. We describe here the specific patterns one can see by experimentation, linking it to diophantine approximation theory.

entry.title: Helicity and the Mañé critical value
entry.summary: We establish a relationship between the helicity of a magnetic flow on a closed surface of genus $\geq 2$ and the Ma\~n\'e critical value.

entry.title: Causal and Anticausal Operators Associated with Input and State to Output Descriptions of Switched Linear Dynamic Systems with Point Lags
entry.summary: The causality properties of linear time-varing systems under constant time lags are investigated based on the definition and use of the definitions of appropriate Hankel and Toeplitz causal and anticausal operators.

entry.title: Constrained Paracomplex Mechanical Systems
entry.summary: In this study, it is introduced paracomplex analogue of Lagrangians and Hamiltonians with constraints in the framework of para-Kaehlerian manifolds. The geometrical and mechanical results on the constrained mechanical system have also been discussed.

entry.title: Lifts of Almost r-Contact and r-Paracontact Structures
entry.summary: In this study, taking into considering lifting theory, we shall obtain both almost complex and paracomplex structures on the tangent bun- dle, based on almost Lorentzian r-contact and r-paracontact manifold.

entry.title: Applications over Complex Lagrangians
entry.summary: In this paper, Lagrangian formalisms of Classical Mechanics was deduced on Kaehlerian manifold being geometric model of a generalized Lagrange space.Then, it was given two applications of complex Euler-Lagrange equations on mechanics system.

entry.title: The billiard ball problem and rotation numbers
entry.summary: We introduce the concepts of rotation numbers and rotation vectors for billiard maps. Our approach is based on the birkhoff ergodic theorem. We anticipate that it will be useful, in particular, for the purpose of establishing the non-ergodicity of billiard in certain domains.

entry.title: Lagrangian and Hamiltonian Dynamics on Para-Kaehlerian Space Form
Dynamical Systems on Bundles
entry.summary: In this study, Hamiltonian and Lagrangian theories, which are mathematical models of mechanical systems, are structured on the horizontal and the vertical distributions of tangent and cotangent bundles. In the end, the geometrical and physical results related to Hamiltonian and Lagrangian dynamical systems are concluded.

entry.title: Hausdorff measure of Julia sets in the exponential family
entry.summary: We consider the Hausdorff measure of Julia sets and escaping sets of exponential maps with respect to certain gauge functions. We give conditions on the growth of the gauge function which imply that the measure is zero or infinity, respectively.

entry.title: Random iterated function systems with smooth invariant densities
entry.summary: We consider some random iterated function systems on the interval and show that the invariant measure has density in $\mathcal{C}^\infty$. To prove this we use some techniques for contractions in cone metrics, applied to the transfer operator.

entry.title: Hedgehogs of Hausdorff dimension one
entry.summary: We present a construction of hedgehogs for holomorphic maps with an indifferent fixed point. We construct, for a family of commuting non-linearisable maps, a common hedgehog of Hausdorff dimension 1, the minimum possible.

entry.title: On systems of nonlinear equations
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce an iterative numerical method to solve systems of nonlinear equations. The third-order convergence of this method is analyzed. Several examples are given to illustrate the efficiency of the proposed method.

entry.title: On the non-equivalence of Lorenz System and Chen System
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that the Chen system with a set of chaotic parameters is not smoothly equivalent to the Lorenz system with any parameters.

entry.title: On the Hausdorff Dimension of Piecewise Hyperbolic Attractors
entry.summary: We study non-invertible piecewise hyperbolic maps in the plane. The Hausdorff dimension of the attractor is calculated in terms of the Lyapunov exponents, provided that the map satisfies a transversality condition. Explicit examples of maps for which this condition holds are given.

entry.title: Topological characterization of the hyperbolic maps in the Sine family
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to establish a topological characterization of all the hyperbolic maps in the Sine family $\{\lambda \sin(z) \:\big{|}\:\lambda \ne 0\}$ which have super-attracting cycles.

entry.title: On new spectral multiplicities for ergodic maps
entry.summary: It is shown that each subset of positive integers that contains 2 is realizable as the set of essential values of the multiplicity function for the Koopman operator of some weakly mixing transformation.

entry.title: Classification of Complex Polynomial Vector Fields in One Complex Variable
entry.summary: A classification of the global structure of monic and centered one-variable complex polynomial vector fields is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 57 pages, 35 figures, submitted to the Journal of Difference Equations and Applications

entry.title: Semigroups of locally injective maps and transfer operators
entry.summary: We consider semigroups of continuous, surjective, locally injective maps of a compact metric space, and whether such semigroups admit a transfer operator.

entry.title: [0,1] is not a Minimality Detector for [0,1]^2
entry.summary: This paper shows that there exists a non-minimal sequence $\bar{x} \in ([0,1]^2)^{\mathbb{N}}$ such that for any continuous function $f:[0,1]^2 \to [0,1]$, the sequence obtained by mapping terms of $\bar{x}$ by $f$ is minimal.

entry.title: Relatively compact Siegel disks with non-locally connected boundaries
entry.summary: We construct holomorphic maps with a Siegel disk whose boundary is not locally connected (and is an indecomposable continuum), yet compactly contained in the domain of definition of the map. Our examples are injective and defined on a subset of C.

entry.title: Distribution of polynomials with cycles of given multiplier
entry.summary: In the family of degree $d$ polynomials the hypersurfaces defined by the existence of a cycle of period $n$ and multiplier $e^{i\theta}$ are shown to equiditribute the bifurcation current.

entry.title: Generating Product Systems
entry.summary: Generalizing Krieger's finite generation theorem, we give conditions for an ergodic system to be generated by a pair of partitions, each required to be measurable with respect to a given sub-algebra, and also required to have a fixed size.

entry.title: Algebraic webs invariant under endomorphisms
entry.summary: We classify noninvertible, holomorphic selfmaps of the projective plane that preserve an algebraic web. In doing so, we obtain interesting examples of critically finite maps.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 1 figure. To appear in Publ. Mat

entry.title: New spectral multiplicities for mixing transformations
entry.summary: It is shown that if $E$ is any subset of $\Bbb N$ such that either $1\in E$ or $2\in E$ then there is a mixing transformation whose set of spectral multiplicities is $E$.

entry.title: Enumerating the basins of infinity of cubic polynomials
entry.summary: We study the dynamics of cubic polynomials restricted to their basins of infinity, and we enumerate topological conjugacy classes with given combinatorics.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Journal of Difference Equations and Applications, special volume in honor of Robert Devaney

entry.title: Volume entropy for surface groups via Bowen-Series like maps
entry.summary: We define a Bowen-Series like map for every geometric presentation of a co-compact surface group and we prove that the volume entropy of the presentation is the topological entropy of this particular (circle) map. Finally we find the minimal volume entropy among geometric presentations.

entry.title: An example showing that fibred quadratic polynomials admit many attracting curves
entry.summary: We present an example of a fibred quadratic polynomial admitting an attracting invariant 2-curve. By an unfolding construction we obtain an example of a fibred quadratic polynomial admitting two attracting invariant curves. This phenomena can not occur in the non-fibred setting.

entry.title: Pre-image Variational Principle for Bundle Random Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: The pre-image topological pressure is defined for bundle random dynamical systems. A variational principle for it has also been given.

entry.title: Integral equivalence of multidimensional differential systems
entry.summary: The bases of the theory of integrals for multidimensional differential systems are stated. The integral equivalence of total differential systems, linear homogeneous systems of partial differential equations, and Pfaff systems of equations is established.

entry.title: Cylindricality and autonomy of integrals and last multipliers of multidimensional differentional systems
entry.summary: The conditions of cylindricality and autonomy of first integrals, last multipliers and integral manifolds for linear homogeneous systems of partial differential equations and total differential systems are established.

entry.title: Gevrey Normal Form and Effective Stability of Lagrangian Tori
entry.summary: A Gevrey symplectic normal form of an analytic and more generally Gevrey smooth Hamiltonian near a Lagrangian invariant torus with a Diophantine vector of rotation is obtained. The normal form implies effective stability of the quasi-periodic motion near the torus.

entry.title: The Hausdorff dimension of average conformal repellers under random perturbation
entry.summary: We prove that the Hausdorff dimension of an average conformal repeller is stable under random perturbations. Our perturbation model uses the notion of a bundle random dynamical system.

entry.title: Linear drift and entropy for regular covers
entry.summary: We consider a regular Riemannian cover $\M$ of a compact Riemannian manifold. The linear drift $\ell$ and the Kaimanovich entropy $h$ are geometric invariants defined by asymptotic properties of the Brownian motion on $\M$. We show that $\ell^2 \leq h$.

entry.title: Rank-one flows of transformations with infinite ergodic index
entry.summary: A rank-one infinite measure preserving flow $T=(T_t)_{t\in\Bbb R}$ is constructed such that for each $t\ne 0$, the Cartesian powers of the transformation $T_t$ are all ergodic.

entry.title: Estimates for solutions of KDV on the phase space of periodic distributions in terms of action variables
entry.summary: We consider the KdV equation on the Sobolev space of periodic distributions. We obtain estimates of the solution of the KdV in terms of action variables.

entry.title: On a substitution subshift related to the Grigorchuk group
entry.summary: We study dynamics of a substitution subshift given by the substitution a->aca, b->d, c->b, d->c that is related to the Grigorchuk group. This dynamical system is shown to be, up to a countable set, conjugated to the binary odometer.

entry.title: Brjuno conditions for linearization in presence of resonances
entry.summary: We present a new proof, under a slightly different (and more natural) arithmetic hypothesis, and using direct computations via power series expansions, of a holomorphic linearization result in presence of resonances originally proved by R\"ussmann.

entry.title: On dynamical Teichmuller spaces
entry.summary: Following ideas from a preprint of the second author, see [2], we investigate relations of dynamical Teichmuller spaces with dynamical objects. We also establish some connections with the theory of deformations of inverse limits and laminations in holomorphic dynamics, see [1]

entry.title: On certain one-counter shifts
entry.summary: Extrapolating from the two-block system of an example of a nonsofic shift hat was given by Lind and Marcus, a class of one-counter shifts is described, that is disjoint from the class of standard one-counter shifts.

entry.title: Entropy and escape of mass for $SL(3,Z)\SL(3,R)$
entry.summary: We study the relation between measure theoretic entropy and escape of mass for the case of a singular diagonal flow on the moduli space of three-dimensional unimodular lattices.

entry.title: Positive Entropy Invariant Measures on the Space of Lattices with Escape of Mass
entry.summary: On the space of unimodular lattices, we construct a sequence of invariant probability measures under a singular diagonal element with high entropy and show that the limit measure is 0.

entry.title: Large normally hyperbolic cylinders in a priori stable Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We prove the existence of normally hyperbolic invariant cylinders in nearly integrable hamiltonian systems.

entry.title: Invariant Lagrange submanifolds of dissipative systems
entry.summary: We study solutions of modified Hamilton-Jacobi equations H(du/dq,q) + cu(q) = 0, q \in M, on a compact manifold M .
